1.verse: The vision of Isaiah son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah:

2.verse: A Nation Sick With Sin - Listen! Heavens, and hear, earth, for ADONAI has spoken: “Sons I have raised and brought up, but they have rebelled against Me.

3.verse: The ox knows its owner, and the donkey its manger, but Israel does not know, My people do not understand.”

4.verse: Oy, a sinful nation, a people weighed down with iniquity, offspring of evildoers, sons dealing corruptly! They have abandoned ADONAI. They have despised Israel’s Holy One. They have turned backwards.

5.verse: Where will you be struck again, as you stray away more and more? The whole head is sick, the whole heart faint.

6.verse: From the foot to the head there is no soundness. Wounds, bruises and raw sores: not pressed, nor bandaged, nor softened with oil.

7.verse: Your land is desolate; your cities are burned with fire; your fields, strangers devour it in your presence— a desolation, overthrown by strangers.

8.verse: So the Daughter of Zion is left as a sukkah in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.

9.verse: Unless ADONAI-Tzva’ot had left us a small remnant, we would have been as Sodom, we would have been as Gomorrah.

10.verse: Hear the word of ADONAI, you rulers of Sodom! Give ear to the Torah of our God, you people of Gomorrah!

11.verse: Worthless Offerings - “For what is it to Me—the multitude of your sacrifices?” says ADONAI. “I am full of burnt offerings of rams and fat of fed animals. I have no delight in the blood of bulls, or of lambs or he-goats.

12.verse: When you come to appear before Me, who has required this at your hand— trampling My courts?

13.verse: Bring no more worthless offerings! Incense is an abomination to Me. New Moon and Shabbat, the calling of convocations —I cannot endure it— iniquity with solemn assembly.

14.verse: Your New Moons and your Festivals My soul hates! They are a burden to Me. I am weary to bear them.

15.verse: When you spread out your hands, I will hide My eyes from you. When you multiply prayers, I will not hear. Your hands are full of blood!”

16.verse: Scarlet Sins as Snow - “Wash and make yourselves clean. Put away the evil of your deeds from before My eyes. Cease to do evil.

17.verse: Learn to do good, seek justice, relieve the oppressed, defend the orphan, plead for the widow.”

18.verse: “Come now, let us reason together,” says ADONAI. “Though your sins be like scarlet, they will be as white as snow. Though they be red like crimson, they will become like wool.

19.verse: If you are willing and obey, you will eat the good of the land.

20.verse: But if you refuse and rebel, you will be devoured with the sword.” For the mouth of ADONAI has spoken.

21.verse: Restore the Faithful City - How the Faithful City became a harlot! She once was full of justice, righteousness lodged in her— but now murderers!

22.verse: Your silver has become dross, your wine diluted by water.

23.verse: Your princes are rebellious and friends with thieves. Everyone loves a bribe and chases after rewards. They do not defend the orphan, nor does a widow’s case come to them.

24.verse: Therefore says the Lord ADONAI-Tzva’ot, the Mighty One of Israel: “Oy! I will get relief from My foes and avenge Myself on My enemies.

25.verse: Then I will turn My hand on you, purge away your dross, and remove all your alloy.

26.verse: I will restore your judges as at first, your counselors as at the start. Afterward you will be called City of Righteousness, Faithful City.

27.verse: Zion will be redeemed with justice, her repentant with righteousness.”

28.verse: But there will be a crushing of transgressors and sinners together. Forsaking ADONAI, they will be consumed.

29.verse: For they will be ashamed of the sacred oaks that you desired, and embarrassed because of the gardens that you have chosen.

30.verse: For you will be like an oak of withering leaf, like a garden that has no water.

31.verse: So the strong will become tinder and his work like a spark— both will burn together, and no one will quench them.

1.verse: The word which Isaiah, son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem:

2.verse: Torah From Jerusalem - It will come to pass in the last days that the mountain of ADONAI’s House will stand firm as head of the mountains and will be exalted above the hills. So all nations will flow to it.

3.verse: Then many peoples will go and say: “Come, let us go up to the mountain of ADONAI, to the House of the God of Jacob! Then He will teach us His ways, and we will walk in His paths.” For Torah will go forth from Zion and the word of ADONAI from Jerusalem.

4.verse: He will judge between the nations and decide for many peoples. They will beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruning knives. Nation will not lift up sword against nation, nor will they learn war any more.

5.verse: Come house of Jacob, let us walk in the light of ADONAI.

6.verse: For You have forsaken Your people, the house of Jacob. For they are filled with soothsayers from the east, and they have clapped hands with the children of foreigners.

7.verse: Their land also is full of silver and gold, nor is there any limit to their treasures. Their land also is full of horses, nor is there any limit to their chariots.

8.verse: Their land also is full of idols. They worship the work of their hands, what their own fingers have made.

9.verse: So humanity bows down as each one lowers himself. Pardon them not!

10.verse: Enter into the rock and hide in the dust, for fear of ADONAI, and the glory of His majesty.

11.verse: Lofty Ones Brought Low - The man of haughty eyes is humbled, the lofty ones brought low, for ADONAI alone will be exalted in that day.

12.verse: For the day of ADONAI-Tzva’ot will be against anyone proud and haughty, against anyone lifted up—he will be humbled,

13.verse: against all the cedars of Lebanon that are lofty and lifted up, against all the oaks of Bashan,

14.verse: against all the high mountains, against all the exalted hills,

15.verse: against every high tower, against every fortified wall,

16.verse: against all the Tarshish ships, and against all the luxury boats.

17.verse: The pride of man will be humbled, the arrogance of men abased, for ADONAI alone will be exalted in that day.

18.verse: The idols will completely pass away.

19.verse: People will go into the caves of the rocks and into the holes of the earth, because of the fear of ADONAI and the splendor of His majesty, when He arises to shake the earth.

20.verse: In that day a man will cast away his idols of silver and his idols of gold, which they made to worship, to the moles and to the bats!

21.verse: They go into the clefts of the rocks and the crevices of the crags, because of fear of ADONAI and the splendor of His majesty, when He arises to shake the earth.

22.verse: Stop trusting in mankind —whose breath is in his nose— for what is he really worth?

1.verse: Downfall of Jerusalem and Judah - For behold! The Lord, ADONAI-Tzva’ot, takes from Jerusalem and from Judah supply and support, every supply of bread and every supply of water,

2.verse: mighty man and man of war, judge, and prophet, fortune-teller and elder,

3.verse: captain of 50 and man of rank, counselor, crafty magician and cunning charmer.

4.verse: I will set children as their rulers. Capricious ones will govern them.

5.verse: The people will oppress one another— each one by his fellow, each one by his neighbor. The child will be insolent to the aged, and dishonarable to the honorable.

6.verse: When a man takes hold of his brother in the house of his father, saying: “You have a cloak, you be our ruler! This ruin is under your charge.”

7.verse: In that day he will protest, saying: “I’m no healer! In my house is no bread or cloak. Don’t make me a ruler of people!”

8.verse: For Jerusalem has stumbled, and Judah is fallen. For their tongue and their actions are against ADONAI, defying the eyes of His glory.

9.verse: The expression of their faces bears witness against them. They display their sin like Sodom— they do not hide it. Oy, their souls! For they brought evil on themselves.

10.verse: The Judge Arises - Say to the righteous, he will be well, eating the fruit of their deeds.

11.verse: Oy, the wicked! It will be bad for him, for the dealing of his hands will be done to him.

12.verse: My people! Children are their oppressors and women rule over them. My people! Your guides mislead you and destroy the way of your paths.

13.verse: ADONAI arises to contend a case, and stands to judge the people.

14.verse: ADONAI will enter into judgment with the elders of His people and with the princes: “You have devoured the vineyard. The plunder of the poor is in your houses.

15.verse: What do you mean by crushing My people and grinding the face of the poor?” says ADONAI Elohei-Tzva’ot.

16.verse: Moreover ADONAI says: “Since the Daughters of Zion are proud, and walk with outstretched necks and seductive eyes, walking and mincing as they go, making a jingling with their feet,

17.verse: therefore ADONAI will smite with a scab the forehead of the Daughters of Zion. ADONAI will expose their secret parts.

18.verse: In that day ADONAI will strip the finery of anklets, headbands, crescents,

19.verse: pendants and bracelets, veils,

20.verse: headdresses, armlets, sashes, perfume vials, amulets,

21.verse: rings and nose-jewels,

22.verse: festal robes, capes, cloaks, purses,

23.verse: lace scarves, fine linen, turbans and veils.

24.verse: Now it will come to pass: Instead of sweet spices there will be rottenness; instead of a sash, rags; instead of curled hair, baldness; instead of fine clothing, sackcloth; and branding instead of beauty.

25.verse: Your men will fall by the sword, and your warriors in battle.

26.verse: Her gates will lament and mourn. Desolate, she will sit on the ground.

1.verse: Seven women will grab hold of one man in that day, saying: “We will eat our own bread, and wear our own apparel. Only let us be called by your name— take away our reproach!”

2.verse: Zion’s End-Time Glory - In that day the Branch of ADONAI will be beautiful and glorious, and the fruit of the land excellent and appealing for Israel’s survivors.

3.verse: So it will come to pass that whoever is left in Zion and whoever remains in Jerusalem will be called holy—everyone who is recorded among the living in Jerusalem.

4.verse: After ADONAI has washed away the filth of the Daughters of Zion and has purged the blood of Jerusalem from her midst by the spirit of judgment and by the spirit of burning,

5.verse: then ADONAI will create over the whole area of Mount Zion and over her convocations, a cloud by day, and smoke and shining of a flaming fire by night. For over all, glory will be a canopy.

6.verse: Then there will be a sukkah for shade by day from the heat, and for refuge and for shelter from storm and from rain.

1.verse: Song of the Vineyard - Let me sing of my beloved, a song of my beloved, about His vineyard. My beloved had a vineyard in a very fertile hill.

2.verse: He dug it out and cleared its stones, planted it with a choice vine, built a tower in the midst of it, and even cut out a winepress. He expected it to yield good grapes, but it yielded worthless grapes.

3.verse: So now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem and people of Judah, please judge between me and my vineyard.

4.verse: What more was there to do for my vineyard that I have not done? Why then, when I expected it to yield good grapes, did it yield worthless grapes?

5.verse: So now, I will make known to you what I will do to my vineyard: I will take away the hedge, and it will be eaten up. I will break down the fence, and it will be trodden down.

6.verse: I will lay it waste: it will not be pruned or hoed, but briers and thorns will come up. I will also command the clouds not to rain on it.

7.verse: For the vineyard of ADONAI-Tzva’ot is the house of Israel, and the people of Judah the planting of His delight. He looked for justice, but behold, bloodshed, for righteousness, but behold, a cry!

8.verse: Judgment for Injustice - Woe to those who join house to house and merge field to field, until there is no room, and you will live alone in the midst of the land!

9.verse: In my ears, ADONAI-Tzva’ot has said: “Surely many houses will be desolate— even grand and fine ones— with no occupants.”

10.verse: Ten acres of vineyard will yield six gallons, and an omer of seed will yield one ephah.

11.verse: Woe to those who rise up early in the morning— so they may pursue liquor, who stay up late at night, until wine inflames them!

12.verse: Harp and lyre, tambourine and flute, and wine are at their banquets. They do not notice ADONAI’s activity nor see the works of His hands.

13.verse: “Therefore My people are in captivity for lack of knowledge. Their honorable men are famished and their multitudes parched with thirst.

14.verse: Therefore Sheol has enlarged its gullet and opened its measureless mouth— down goes her glory, her tumult, her uproar, and the revelry in her.

15.verse: So humanity will be bowed down mankind will be humbled, and the eyes of the lofty humbled.”

16.verse: But ADONAI-Tzva’ot will be exalted through justice, and the Holy God consecrated through righteousness.

17.verse: Then lambs will graze as if in their own pasture, and nomads will eat in the ruins of the wealthy.

18.verse: Oy to those that drag iniquity along with cords of deceit, and sin as if with a cart rope!

19.verse: They say: “Let Him hurry up and hasten His work, so we may see it! Let the plan of the Holy One of Israel draw near and come, so we may know it!”

20.verse: Oy to those who call evil good and good evil, who present darkness as light and light as darkness, who present bitter as sweet, and sweet as bitter!

21.verse: Oy to those who are wise in their own eyes, and clever in their own sight!

22.verse: Oy to those who are heroes at drinking wine, and valiant at mixing drinks,

23.verse: who justify the wicked for a bribe, and deprive the innocent of justice!

24.verse: Therefore, as a tongue of fire consumes straw, and as chaff collapses into the flame, so their root will be like rot, and their blossom will go up like dust. For they have rejected the Torah of ADONAI–Tzva’ot, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

25.verse: Therefore ADONAI’s anger is kindled against His people. When He has stretched out His hand against them and struck them, the hills trembled, and their carcasses were like refuse in the streets. For all this His anger is not turned away, yet His hand is still outstretched.

26.verse: He will lift up a banner to nations far off, and will whistle for them from the ends of the earth. Look! Swiftly, speedily they come!

27.verse: None will be weary and none stumble among them; none will slumber or sleep; no belt will be loose at the waist; no strap of sandals be broken.

28.verse: Their arrows are sharp and all their bows bent; their horse hooves will be like flint and their wheels like a whirlwind.

29.verse: Their roaring will be like a lion. They will growl like young lions— yes, they will roar, seize their prey and carry it away safely— and there will be none to rescue.

30.verse: They will roar against them like the roaring of the sea. If one looks to the land, behold, darkness and distress! The light is darkened by the clouds.

1.verse: Judah’s Encounter with ADONAI - In the year of King Uzziah’s death, I saw ADONAI sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, and the train of His robe filled the Temple.

2.verse: Seraphim were standing above Him. Each had six wings: with two he covered his face and with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.

3.verse: One called out to another, and said: “Holy, holy, holy, is ADONAI-Tzva’ot! The whole earth is full of His glory.”

4.verse: Then the posts of the door trembled at the voice of those who called, and the House was filled with smoke.

5.verse: Then I said: “Oy to me! For I am ruined! For I am a man of unclean lips, and I am dwelling among a people of unclean lips. For my eyes have seen the King, ADONAI-Tzva’ot!”

6.verse: Then one of the seraphim flew to me, with a glowing coal in his hand, which he had taken with tongs from the altar.

7.verse: He touched my mouth with it and said: “Behold, this has touched your lips. Your iniquity is taken away, and your sins atoned for.”

8.verse: Then I heard the voice of ADONAI saying: “Whom should I send, and who will go for Us?” So I said, “Hineni. Send me.”

9.verse: Then He said: “Go! Tell this people: ‘Hear without understanding, and see without perceiving.’

10.verse: Make the heart of this people fat, their ears heavy, and their eyes blind. Else they would see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and return, and be healed.”

11.verse: Then I said, “ADONAI, how long?” He answered, “Until cities are laid waste and without inhabitant, houses are without people, and the land is utterly desolate.

12.verse: ADONAI will drive people far away. The desertion of the land will be vast.

13.verse: Though a tenth still be in it, it will again be burned. As a terebinth tree or as an oak whose stump remains when cut down, so the holy seed will be the stump.”

1.verse: Reassurance Regarding a Threat - Now it came about in the days of Ahaz son of Jotham, son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that King Rezin of Aram and King Pekah, son of Remaliah of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.

2.verse: When it was reported to the house of David saying: “Aram is camped in Ephraim,” his heart as well as the heart of his people shook like the trees of the forest shaking with the wind.

3.verse: Then ADONAI said to Isaiah: “Go out now to meet Ahaz—you and Shear-jashub your son, at the end of the aqueduct from the upper pool, in the highway of the fullers’ field;

4.verse: and say to him, ‘Keep calm and be quiet. Do not fear nor be faint-hearted because of these two stubs of smoldering firebrands, because of the fierce anger of Rezin and Aram, nor of the son of Remaliah,

5.verse: because Aram has plotted harm against you, along with Ephraim and the son of Remaliah saying,

6.verse: “Let us go up against Judah, terrorize it, divide it for ourselves, and appoint Tabeel’s son as king in the midst of it.”

7.verse: Thus says ADONAI Elohim: “It will not stand, nor will it occur.

8.verse: For the head of Aram is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin. Within 65 years Ephraim will be broken and not be a people.

9.verse: The head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah’s son. If you do not trust, you will not stand.”

10.verse: The Sign of Immanuel - Then ADONAI spoke again to Ahaz saying,

11.verse: “Ask for a sign from ADONAI your God—from the depths of Sheol or the heights of Heaven.”

12.verse: But Ahaz said, “I won’t ask—I wouldn’t test ADONAI!”

13.verse: Then he said, “Hear now, house of David! Is it a small thing for you to weary men? Will you also weary my God?

14.verse: Therefore ADONAI Himself will give you a sign: Behold, the virgin will conceive. When she is giving birth to a son, she will call his name Immanuel.

15.verse: He will be eating curds and honey by the time he knows to refuse evil and choose good.

16.verse: For before the boy knows to refuse evil and choose good, the land of the two kings you dread will be abandoned.

17.verse: ADONAI will bring—on you, on your people and on your father’s house such days as have never come since the day Ephraim separated from Judah—the king of Assyria!

18.verse: In that day ADONAI will whistle for the fly at the source of the Nile of Egypt and for the bee in the land of Assyria.

19.verse: Then they will come, all of them—and will settle in the steep wadis and in the clefts of the cliffs and in all the thorn bushes and in all the watering holes.

20.verse: In that day ADONAI will shave—with a razor hired beyond the River—with the king of Assyria—the head and the hair of the legs, and even clip off the beard.

21.verse: In that day it will be that a man will rear a calf and two sheep,

22.verse: and from the abundant milk they give, he will eat curds—for anyone left in the land will eat curds and honey.

23.verse: In that day it will be that every place where there were 1,000 vines worth 1,000 silver shekels will become briers and thorns.

24.verse: With arrows and bows one will come there, since all the land will become briers and thorns.

25.verse: As for all the hills that were tilled with the hoe—you will not go there for fear of briers and thorns. Instead it will be for grazing of oxen and roaming of sheep.

1.verse: Assyria Will Rise to Judah’s Neck - Then ADONAI said to me: “Take yourself a great tablet, and write on it with a man’s stylus: ‘Maher-shalal-hashbaz.’”

2.verse: So I took for myself trustworthy witnesses—Uriah the kohen and Zechariah son of Jeberechiah.

3.verse: Then I went to the prophetess; and she conceived and bore a son. Then ADONAI said to me: “Call his name Maher-shalal-hashbaz.

4.verse: For before the child will have knowledge to cry ‘my father!’ or ‘my mother!’ the wealth of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria will be carried away before the king of Assyria.”

5.verse: Then ADONAI spoke to me further, saying:

6.verse: “Because these people have refused the softly flowing waters of Shiloah, and rejoice with Rezin and Remaliah’s son,

7.verse: therefore behold, ADONAI is bringing on them the waters of the River—mighty and massive— Assyria’s king with all his glory! It will rise over all its channels and spill over all its banks.

8.verse: Then it will sweep through Judah, overflow as it passes through, reaching even to the neck! So the spread of its wings will be the full breadth of your land! Immanuel!

9.verse: Make an uproar, O peoples— but you will be broken in pieces. Give ear, all you of far countries. Arm yourselves—yet be shattered! Arm yourselves—yet be shattered!

10.verse: Take counsel together, but it will amount to nothing. Speak a word, but it will not stand. For God is with us!

11.verse: For thus ADONAI spoke to me, with a strong hand, warning me that I should not walk in the way of these people, saying:

12.verse: “Do not say: ‘It’s a conspiracy!’ about everything that these people call a conspiracy. You must not fear or tremble at what they fear.

13.verse: ADONAI-Tzva’ot, Him will you sanctify, and let Him be your fear, trembling at Him.

14.verse: He will be a Sanctuary, but a stone of stumbling and a rock of offence to both the houses of Israel, a trap and a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

15.verse: Many among them will stumble, fall, and be broken, snared and caught.

16.verse: Bind up the testimony, seal the instruction with My disciples.

17.verse: I will wait for ADONAI, who is hiding His face from the house of Jacob, and I will look eagerly for Him.

18.verse: Here I am with the children that ADONAI has given me as signs and wonders in Israel, from ADONAI-Tzva’ot who dwells on Mount Zion.

19.verse: When they say to you: “Consult the mediums and necromancers who chirp and mutter,” shouldn’t a people seek their God? Should a people consult the dead on behalf of the living?

20.verse: To Torah and to the testimony! If they do not speak according to this word, it is because they have no light.

21.verse: They will pass this way that are hard-pressed and hungry, and it will turn out that when they are hungry, they will become enraged and curse their king and their God. Whether they turn their faces upward

22.verse: or look to the earth, behold, distress and darkness, the gloom of anguish, and they will be driven into darkness.

1.verse: The people walking in darkness will see a great light. Upon those dwelling in the land of the shadow of death, light will shine.

2.verse: You will multiply the nation. You will increase the joy. They will rejoice before You like the joy in the harvest, as they revel when they divide spoil.

3.verse: For You will break the burdensome yoke and the rod on his shoulder— the war-club of his oppressor— as in the day of Midian.

4.verse: For every stomping boot quaking and cloak rolled in blood will be for burning— fuel for the fire.

5.verse: Prince of Peace - For to us a child is born, a son will be given to us, and the government will be upon His shoulder. His Name will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God My Father of Eternity, Prince of Peace.

6.verse: Of the increase of His government and shalom there will be no end— on the throne of David and over His kingdom— to establish it and uphold it through justice and righteousness from now until forevermore. The zeal of ADONAI-Tzva’ot will accomplish this.

7.verse: Warning About Defiance - ADONAI sent a word to Jacob, and it fell upon Israel.

8.verse: All the people will know what Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria say in pride and in arrogance of heart:

9.verse: “The bricks are fallen, but we will rebuild with cut stones. The sycamores are cut down, but we will replace them with cedars.”

10.verse: Therefore ADONAI raises up Rezin’s adversaries against them, and spurs on his enemies.

11.verse: The Arameans from the east and the Philistines from the west— they will devour Israel with open mouth. For all this His anger is not turned away, yet His hand is still outstretched.

12.verse: Yet the people will not turn back to the One who strikes them, nor will they seek ADONAI-Tzva’ot.

13.verse: So ADONAI will cut off from Israel head and tail, palm branch and bulrush in a single day.

14.verse: The elder and the man of rank— he is the head. The prophet who teaches falsehood— he is the tail.

15.verse: The leaders of this people lead them astray. Those they mislead are swallowed up.

16.verse: Therefore ADONAI will have no joy in their young men, nor will He have compassion on their orphans and widows, for everyone is ungodly and an evildoer, and every mouth speaks foolishness. For all this His anger is not turned away, yet His hand is still outstretched.

17.verse: For wickedness burns like a fire and consumes the briers and thorns It kindles the thickets of the forest, so they roll up in a column of smoke.

18.verse: By the wrath of ADONAI-Tzva’ot is the land burnt up; The people are as fuel for the fire. No one spares his brother.

19.verse: One grabs with the right hand but is hungry, and eats with the left hand but is not satisfied. Everyone will eat the flesh of his own arm—

20.verse: Manasseh will devour Ephraim, and Ephraim, Manasseh, both are against Judah. For all this His anger is not turned away, yet His hand is outstretched.

1.verse: Oy to Unjust Legislators - Oy to those enacting unjust decrees and recording corrupt legislation,

2.verse: to deprive the helpless of justice and rob the rights of the poor of My people, so that widows may be their spoil and orphans their prey!

3.verse: What will you do in the day of visitation, when desolation comes from afar? To whom will you flee for help? Where will you leave your wealth?

4.verse: One can only crouch among the captives or collapse among the slain. For all this His anger is not turned away, yet His hand is still outstretched.

5.verse: Assyria, the Rod - Oy to Assyria, the rod of My anger— the club in their hand is My indignation!

6.verse: I am sending it against an ungodly nation, and against the people of My fury I am commissioning it, to take spoil and plunder, to trample them down like mud in the streets.

7.verse: Yet that is not what Assyria intends, nor is that what he is thinking about. Rather his heart is to destroy, and to cut down nations—only a few!

8.verse: For he says: “Aren’t all my princes kings?

9.verse: Isn’t Calno like Carchemish? Isn’t Hamath like Arpad? Isn’t Samaria like Damascus?

10.verse: As my hand has reached the kingdoms of the idols— with more graven images than Jerusalem and Samaria—

11.verse: as I’ve done to Samaria and her idols, won’t I also do to Jerusalem and her idols?”

12.verse: Therefore it will come to pass, when ADONAI finishes all His work on Mount Zion and on Jerusalem, “I will punish the fruit of the arrogant heart of the king of Assyria, and the glorying of his haughty eyes.”

13.verse: For he said: “By the strength of my own hand I’ve done it, and my own wisdom, for I am shrewd! I abolished the borders of peoples, and plundered their treasures. As a mighty one I cast down inhabitants.

14.verse: My hand found the riches of the peoples as a nest— like gathering forsaken eggs, I have gathered the entire earth. Not a wing fluttered, not a beak opened or chirped!”

15.verse: Should the axe boast against the One who chops with it? Should the saw magnify itself against the One who wields it? It would be like a rod waving the One who lifts it, or like a staff hoisting up the One who is not wood!

16.verse: Therefore will the Lord ADONAI-Tzva’ot, send leanness among his fat ones. Under its glory He will kindle a burning like a blazing fire.

17.verse: So the light of Israel will become a fire, and its Holy One a flame. He will burn and consume its thorns and briers in one day.

18.verse: Both the glory of his forest and his fruitful field, he will consume, both soul and body. It will be like a sick man wasting away.

19.verse: The remnant of the trees of his forest will be so few, a child could record them.

20.verse: A Remnant Will Return - Yet it will come about in that day that the remnant of Israel— those of the house of Jacob who escaped— will never again depend on the one who struck them down, but will depend upon ADONAI, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.

21.verse: A remnant will return, even the remnant of Jacob, to the Mighty God.

22.verse: For though your people, O Israel, be as the sand of the sea, only a remnant of them will return. Destruction has been decreed. Justice overflows.

23.verse: For a complete destruction, as decreed, will ADONAI Elohei-Tzva’ot make throughout the whole land.

24.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI Elohei-Tzva’ot: “O My people dwelling in Zion, do not be afraid of Assyria, though he strike you with the war-club, and lift up his rod against you, as Egypt did.

25.verse: “For in a very little while My indignation against you will be spent, and My anger will turn to their destruction.”

26.verse: ADONAI-Tzva’ot will stir up against him a scourge, as in the slaughter of Midian at the Rock of Oreb. As His staff was over the sea, so will He lift it up, as He did in Egypt.

27.verse: In that day his burden will be taken off your shoulders, and his yoke off your neck. Indeed, the yoke will be broken because of fatness.

28.verse: Assyria Advancing - He has come to Aiath, and passed through Migron. At Michmas he deposited his supplies.

29.verse: They have crossed over the pass. They have taken up lodging at Geba. Ramah is terrified; Gibeath-shaul has fled.

30.verse: Shriek your cry, daughter of Gallim! Listen, O Laish! O poor Anathoth!

31.verse: Madmenah has fled. The inhabitants of Gebim take cover.

32.verse: This very day he will halt at Nob. He shakes his fist at the mountain of the Daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.

33.verse: Behold, the Lord, ADONAI-Tzva’ot will lop off the branches with terror! So the tall ones will be cut down and the lofty ones laid low.

34.verse: Yes, He will hack down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon with its majesty will fall.

1.verse: The Branch From David - Then a shoot will come forth out of the stem of Jesse, and a branch will bear fruit out of His roots.

2.verse: The Ruach of ADONAI will rest upon Him, the Spirit of wisdom and insight, the Spirit of counsel and might, the Spirit of knowledge and of the fear of ADONAI.

3.verse: His delight will be in the fear of ADONAI. He will not judge by what His eyes see, nor decide by what His ears hear.

4.verse: But with righteousness He will judge the poor, and decide with fairness for the poor of the land. He will strike the land with the rod of His mouth, and with the breath of His lips He will slay the wicked.

5.verse: Also righteousness will be the belt around His loins, and faithfulness the belt around His waist.

6.verse: Messianic Age of Shalom - The wolf will dwell with the lamb, the leopard will lie down with the kid, the calf and the young lion and the yearling together, and a little child will lead them.

7.verse: The cow and the bear will graze, their young ones lie down together, and the lion will eat straw like an ox.

8.verse: A nursing child will play by a cobra’s hole, and a weaned child will put his hand into a viper’s den.

9.verse: They will not hurt or destroy in all My holy mountain, for the earth will be full of the knowledge of ADONAI, as the waters cover the sea.

10.verse: Second Return from Diaspora - It will also come about in that day that the root of Jesse will stand as a banner for the peoples. The nations will seek for Him, and His resting place will be glorious.

11.verse: It will also come about in that day that my Lord will again redeem—a second time with His hand—the remnant of His people who remain from Assyria, from Egypt, from Pathros, from Cush, Elam, Shinar, Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.

12.verse: He will lift up a banner for the nations, and assemble the dispersed of Israel, and gather the scattered of Judah from the four corners of the earth.

13.verse: Ephraim’s envy will end, those hostile to Judah will be cut off. Ephraim will not be jealous of Judah, and Judah will not harass Ephraim.

14.verse: They will swoop down on the Philistine slope to the west. Together they will plunder the children of the east— laying their hand on Edom and Moab, the children of Ammon obeying them.

15.verse: Then ADONAI will dry up the gulf of the Egyptian sea. He will wave His hand over the River with His scorching wind, and will strike it into seven streams, and let men walk over in sandals.

16.verse: So there will be a highway for the remnant of His people who remain, from Assyria, as there was for Israel in the day they came up out of the land of Egypt.

1.verse: Wells of Salvation - In that day you will say: “I will give You thanks, ADONAI, for though You were angry with me, Your anger is turned away, and You comfort me.

2.verse: Behold, God is my salvation! I will trust and will not be afraid. For the Lord ADONAI is my strength and my song. He also has become my salvation.”

3.verse: With joy you will draw water from the wells of salvation.

4.verse: In that day you will say: “Give thanks to ADONAI. Proclaim His Name! Declare His works to the peoples, so they remember His exalted Name.

5.verse: Sing to ADONAI, for He has done gloriously. Let this be known in all the earth.

6.verse: Cry out and shout, inhabitant of Zion! For great in your midst is the Holy One of Israel.”

1.verse: End of Babylon and the World - The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz saw:

2.verse: Lift up a banner on a bare mountain, raise a voice to them, wave a hand, so that they may enter the gates of the nobles.

3.verse: I have commanded My consecrated ones, yes, I have called My mighty ones, My proud exulting ones, for My fury.

4.verse: A sound of tumult in the mountains like that of many people! A sound of uproar of kingdoms, of nations gathered! ADONAI-Tzva’ot is mustering the army for battle.

5.verse: They are coming from a far country— from the end of the heavens— ADONAI and the weapons of His wrath, to destroy the whole land.

6.verse: Wail, for the day of ADONAI is near! it will come as destruction from Shaddai.

7.verse: Therefore all hands will fall limp, and every man’s heart will melt.

8.verse: They will be terrified; pain and anguish will take hold of them; they will writhe as a woman in labor; they will look aghast at one another— their faces aflame!

9.verse: Behold, the day of ADONAI comes, cruel, full of wrath and fierce fury, to make the earth a desolation, and destroy its sinners from it.

10.verse: For the stars of heaven and their constellations will not give their light. The rising sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light.

11.verse: I will punish the world for evil, and the wicked for their iniquity. I will put an end to the arrogance of the proud, and abase the insolence of tyrants.

12.verse: I will make people scarcer than gold, even than the pure gold of Ophir.

13.verse: Therefore I will make heaven tremble, and the earth will shake from its place at the wrath of ADONAI-Tzva’ot, in the day of His fierce fury.

14.verse: It will be like a hunted gazelle, or like sheep with no one gathering. Each will return to his own people, each will flee to his own country.

15.verse: Everyone found will be thrust through. Everyone caught will fall by the sword.

16.verse: Their babes will be dashed in pieces before their eyes. Their houses will be plundered, and their wives ravished.

17.verse: Behold, I will stir up against them the Medes, who will not value silver and will take no delight in gold.

18.verse: Their bows will cut down the young men, with no pity on the fruit of the womb, nor will their eye spare children.

19.verse: So Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of Chaldean pride, will be just as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.

20.verse: It will never be inhabited, nor will it be dwelt in from generation to generation, nor will an Arab pitch a tent there, nor will shepherds let flocks lie there.

21.verse: But desert creatures will lie there. Their houses will be full of owls. Ostriches will dwell there, and goat-demons will dance there.

22.verse: Hyenas will howl in their citadels and jackals in their pleasant palaces. Her time is near to come— her days will not drag on long.

1.verse: God’s People Restored - For ADONAI will have compassion on Jacob and will again choose Israel and settle them in their own land. The outsider will join himself with them and will cling to the house of Jacob.

2.verse: The peoples will take them and escort them to their place. The house of Israel will possess them in the land of ADONAI as servants and handmaids. They will take their captors captive, and rule over their oppressors.

3.verse: Taunt Against Babylon’s King - Now in the day when ADONAI will give you rest from your sorrow and your turmoil, and from the hard service you were forced to do,

4.verse: you will take up this taunt against the king of Babylon and say: “How the taskmaster has ceased! The raging oppressor, exacter of gold, has ceased!

5.verse: ADONAI has broken the rod of the wicked, the scepter of the rulers,

6.verse: which struck the people in wrath with continual strokes, which ruled the nations in fury, with relentless persecution.

7.verse: The whole earth is at rest, and quiet. They break forth with a ringing cry!

8.verse: Even the cypress trees rejoice over you, along with the cedars of Lebanon: “Since you were laid low, no woodcutter comes up against us.”

9.verse: Sheol from below is excited about you, to meet you at your coming! He stirs up the dead spirits for you, even the chief ones of the earth. He makes all the kings of the nations rise up from their thrones.

10.verse: They all answer and say to you: “Even you have become as weak as us? Have you become like us?

11.verse: Your pomp is brought down to Sheol with the music of your harps. Maggots are spread out under you, and worms cover you.”

12.verse: Shining One Fallen From Heaven - How you have fallen from heaven, O brighstar, son of the dawn! How you are cut down to the earth, you who made the nations prostrate!

13.verse: You said in your heart: “I will ascend to heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God. I will sit upon the mount of meeting, in the uttermost parts of the north.

14.verse: I will ascend above the high places of the clouds— I will make myself like Elyon.”

15.verse: Yet you will be brought down to Sheol, to the lowest parts of the Pit.

16.verse: Those who see you will stare at you, reflecting on what has become of you: “Is this the one who shook the earth, who made kingdoms tremble,

17.verse: who made the world a wilderness and destroyed its cities, who never opened the house of his prisoners?”

18.verse: All the kings of the nations, all of them, lie in glory, each in his own house.

19.verse: But you are cast out of your tomb as a discarded branch, garment of the slain, pierced with a sword, dumped into a stony pit, a corpse trodden underfoot.

20.verse: You will not join with them in burial, because you ruined your land, you slaughtered your own people. The offspring of evildoers will never be named.

21.verse: Prepare slaughter for his children for the iniquity of their fathers, so they would not rise up and possess the land, or fill the face of the earth with cities.

22.verse: “For I will rise up against them”—it is a declaration of ADONAI-Tzva’ot—“and I will cut off from Babylon name and remnant, offshoot and offspring,” declares ADONAI.

23.verse: “I will also make it a possession for the porcupine, with marshes of water, and I will sweep it with the broom of destruction.” It is a declaration of ADONAI-Tzva’ot.

24.verse: ADONAI Tzva’ot has sworn, saying: “Surely, as I thought it, so it will be. As I have purposed, so it will stand.

25.verse: I will break Assyria in My land. On My mountains I will trample him. Then his yoke will be taken off them, his burden removed from their shoulder.

26.verse: This is the purpose planned for the whole earth, and this is the hand that is stretched out over all the nations.”

27.verse: For ADONAI-Tzva’ot has purposed, so who will annul it? Since His hand is stretched out, who will turn it back?

28.verse: Doom of Philistia - In the year king Ahaz died came this burden:

29.verse: Do not rejoice, all you of Philistia, that the rod that struck you is broken. For from the serpent’s root comes a viper and its fruit will be a flying serpent.

30.verse: The firstborn of the poor will feed, and the needy will lie down in safety. I will kill your root with famine, and your survivors will be slain.

31.verse: Wail, O gate! Cry, O city! Melt away, all you of Philistia! For smoke is coming from the north, and there is no straggler in its ranks.

32.verse: What will they answer the messengers of the nation? For ADONAI has founded Zion, and the afflicted of His people will find refuge in her.

1.verse: The burden of Moab. For in the night that Ar is devastated, Moab is ruined; for in the night that Kir is devastated, Moab is ruined.

2.verse: He has gone up to the shrine, to Dibon, to the high places to weep. Moab wails over Nebo and Medeba. Every head is bald, every beard shaven.

3.verse: In their streets they wear sackcloth. On their housetops and in their plazas, everyone wails, weeping profusely.

4.verse: Heshbon and Elealeh cry out. Their voice is heard as far as Jahaz. Therefore the soldiers of Moab cry aloud, his soul faints within him.

5.verse: My heart cries out for Moab. Her fugitives are as far as Zoar as a three year old heifer, for by the ascent of Luhith they go up with weeping, for on the way of Horonaim they raise a cry of distress.

6.verse: The waters of Nimrim are desolate. The grass is withered away, the new grass withers, there is nothing green.

7.verse: Therefore the riches they had gotten and whatever they have stored, they carry over the Wadi of Willows.

8.verse: For the cry has gone around the borders of Moab, the wailing to Eglaim, and the wailing to Beer-elim.

9.verse: For the waters of Dimon are full of blood, but I will bring on Dimon even more— a lion for those escaping from Moab, and for those remaining in the land.

1.verse: Send lambs to the ruler of the land from Sela in the desert to the mountain of the Daughter of Zion.

2.verse: For like fluttering birds, scattered from a nest, so will the daughters of Moab be at the fords of Arnon.

3.verse: ‘Give counsel, execute justice. Cast your shadow like night at noonday. Hide the refugees, do not betray the fugitive.

4.verse: Let My refugees stay with you. Be for Moab a hiding place from the face of the destroyer. For the extortion is at an end, devastation ceases, oppressors are gone from the land.

5.verse: A throne will be established in mercy, and One will sit on it in truth —in the tent of David— One who seeks justice and is ready for righteousness.

6.verse: We have heard of the pride of Moab— very proud is he— of his haughtiness, his arrogance, his insolence, and his dishonest boasting.

7.verse: Therefore Moab will wail for Moab— everyone will wail! For the sweet cakes of Kir-hareseth you will moan, utterly stricken.

8.verse: For the fields of Heshbon have withered, as well as the vine of Sibmah. Rulers of nations have trampled the choice clusters, that reached as far as Jazer and into the desert, its branches spread out and crossed to the sea.

9.verse: Therefore I will weep bitterly for Jazer, for the vine of Sibmah. I will drench you with my tears, O Heshbon and Elealeh. For on your summer and your harvest the battle cry has fallen.

10.verse: Gladness and joy are taken away from the fruitful field. In the vineyards, no singing for joy no happy shouting, no treading wine in the presses. I have made the shouting stop.

11.verse: Therefore my heart moans for Moab like a lyre, and my inward part for Kir-heres.

12.verse: So it will be, when Moab is weary upon the high place and comes to his sanctuary to pray, it will do him no good.

13.verse: This is the word that ADONAI spoke concerning Moab in the past.

14.verse: But now ADONAI has spoken, saying: “Within three years (as with the years of a hired worker), the glory of Moab will be disgraced; for all his large population, the remnant will be very small and feeble.”

1.verse: The burden of Damascus: Behold, Damascus will cease as a city and will become a ruinous heap.

2.verse: The cities of Aroer are forsaken. They will be for flocks—they will lie down and no one will frighten them.

3.verse: The fortress will also cease from Ephraim, and the kingdom from Damascus. The remnant of Aram will be like the glory of Bnei-Yisrael. It is a declaration of ADONAI-Tzva’ot.

4.verse: Jacob’s Glory Fades - Now in that day Jacob’s glory will fade, and the fatness of his flesh grow lean.

5.verse: It will be as when the harvester gathers the standing grain and reaps the heads with his arm, as when one gleans grain in the valley of Rephaim.

6.verse: Only gleanings will remain, as when beating an olive tree— two or three olives at the very top, four or five on a fruitful tree’s branches. It is a declaration of ADONAI God of Israel.

7.verse: In that day a man will look to his Maker and his eyes will turn to the Holy One of Israel.

8.verse: He will not look to the altars, the work of his hands, nor will he look to what his fingers have made—neither the Asherah poles nor the sun-images.

9.verse: In that day the strong cities will be like forsaken forests and treetops that were abandoned, because of Bnei-Yisrael—they will be laid waste.

10.verse: For you have forgotten the God of your salvation and you have not remembered the Rock of your strength. Therefore you plant delightful plants and set out exotic vines.

11.verse: In the day that you plant, you fence it in, and in the morning you made your seed to sprout— but the harvest will be a heap in a day of grief and incurable pain.

12.verse: Oy! The uproar of many peoples who roar like the roaring of the seas. The rumbling of nations, who rush in like the rumbling of mighty waters!

13.verse: The nations will rush in like the rumbling of many waters, but He will rebuke them so they will flee far away, chased like chaff on the hills before the wind, like whirling dust before the storm.

14.verse: At evening time—sudden terror! Before morning, they are no more. This is the reward of those who plunder us and the lot of those who pillage us.

1.verse: Ode of Ethiopia - Oy! The land of whirring wings, which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia,

2.verse: that sends ambassadors by sea, in papyrus vessels upon the water. Go, swift messengers, to a nation tall and smooth-skinned, to a people feared far and wide, a nation powerful and oppressive, whose land the rivers divide.

3.verse: All you inhabitants of the world, and dwellers on earth, when a banner is raised on the mountains, look! when a shofar is blown, listen!

4.verse: For so ADONAI has said to me: “I will remain quiet, and look from My dwelling place, like shimmering heat in sunshine, like a cloud of dew in harvest heat.”

5.verse: For before the harvest, as soon as blossoming is over and flower becomes ripening grape, He will cut off the shoots with pruning knives, He will cut back and remove the twigs.

6.verse: They will be left together for the mountain birds of prey and the beasts of the land. The birds of prey will summer on them, and all the beasts of the land will winter upon them.

7.verse: At that time tribute will be brought to ADONAI-Tzva’ot from a nation tall and smooth-skinned, from a people feared far and wide, a nation powerful and oppressive, whose land the rivers divide— to the place of the Name of ADONAI-Tzva’ot—Mount Zion!

1.verse: Egypt Will Know ADONAI - The burden of Egypt: Behold, ADONAI rides upon a swift cloud and comes to Egypt. Egypt’s idols tremble before Him and Egypt’s heart melts within them.

2.verse: I will stir up Egyptian against Egyptian. Everyone will fight against his brother, and everyone against his neighbor— city against city, kingdom against kingdom.

3.verse: The spirit of Egypt will drain within it, and I will confuse its counsel. So they will resort to idols, charmers, mediums and familiar spirits.

4.verse: I will give the Egyptians into the hand of a cruel master— a fierce king will rule over them. It is a declaration of ADONAI-Tzva’ot.

5.verse: The waters from the sea will dry up, and the river will be drained dry.

6.verse: Then the channels will stink. The streams of Egypt will dwindle and dry up. Reeds and rushes will rot.

7.verse: The bulrushes by the Nile, by the mouth of the Nile, and everything sown by the Nile will wither, blow away and be no more.

8.verse: Then the fishermen will lament. All who cast hooks in the Nile will mourn, and those who spread nets on the waters will languish.

9.verse: Moreover the workers of fine flax, and the weavers of white cloth will be ashamed.

10.verse: Her pillars will be crushed, All hired workers will be grieved in soul.

11.verse: The princes of Zoan are utter fools. Pharaoh’s wisest counselors are stupid. How can you say to Pharaoh, “I am the son of the wise, a son of ancient kings”?

12.verse: Where then are your wise men? Let them tell you now! Let them know what ADONAI-Tzva’ot has purposed against Egypt.

13.verse: The princes of Zoan are fools. The princes of Noph are deceived. The cornerstone of her tribes have led Egypt astray.

14.verse: ADONAI has mixed within her a spirit of dizziness. They make Egypt stagger in every work, as a drunkard staggers in his vomit.

15.verse: There will be no work for Egypt to do, for head or tail, palm branch or rush.

16.verse: In that day Egypt will be like women trembling with fear, because of the shaking hand of ADONAI-Tzva’ot, which He is about to wave over it.

17.verse: The land of Judah will terrify Egypt. Anyone who mentions it will be afraid, because of what ADONAI-Tzva’ot has surely purposed against it.

18.verse: In that day five cities in the land of Egypt will speak the language of Canaan, swearing allegiance to ADONAI-Tzva’ot. One used to be called the City of the Sun.

19.verse: In that day there will be an altar to ADONAI in the middle of the land of Egypt, and next to the border a pillar to ADONAI.

20.verse: It will be as a sign and a witness to ADONAI-Tzva’ot in the land of Egypt. For they will cry to ADONAI because of oppressors, and He will send them a savior and defender—and he will deliver them.

21.verse: So ADONAI will make Himself known to Egypt, and the Egyptians will know ADONAI in that day. They will worship with sacrifice and offering. They will vow to ADONAI, and fulfill it.

22.verse: So ADONAI will strike Egypt—striking yet healing—so they will return to ADONAI, and He will respond to them and heal them.

23.verse: In that day there will be a highway from Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrians will come to Egypt, and the Egyptians to Assyria, and the Egyptians will worship with the Assyrians.

24.verse: In that day Israel will be the third, along with Egypt and Assyria—a blessing in the midst of the earth.

25.verse: For ADONAI-Tzva’ot has blessed, saying: “Blessed is Egypt My people, and Assyria My handiwork, and Israel My inheritance.”

1.verse: Sign of Nakedness - In the year that the Tartan came to Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him and he fought against Ashdod and captured it,

2.verse: at that time ADONAI spoke by Isaiah the son of Amoz saying, “Go, remove the sackcloth from your loins and your sandals from your feet.” So he did so, walking naked and barefoot.

3.verse: Then ADONAI said: “Just as My servant Isaiah has walked naked and barefoot for three years, as a sign and a wonder against Egypt and Ethiopia,

4.verse: so will the king of Assyria lead away the captives of Egypt and the exiles of Ethiopia, young and old, naked and barefoot, with their buttocks uncovered, to Egypt’s shame.

5.verse: So they will be dismayed and ashamed, because they hoped in Ethiopia and boasted in Egypt.

6.verse: Then the inhabitants of the coastland will say in that day, ‘Look, such is our hope—there we fled for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria! Now, how will we escape?’”

1.verse: Watchman, Pay Attention! - The burden of the desert by the sea: As windstorms sweep over the South, so it comes from the desert, a terrifying land.

2.verse: A harsh vision has been shown to me: “The traitor betrays, and the plunderer plunders. Go up, Elam! Besiege, Media! I have put an end to all her groaning.”

3.verse: Therefore my body is filled with pain. Pangs have taken hold of me like the pangs of a woman in labor. I am bewildered by what I hear, terrified by what I see.

4.verse: My heart is bewildered, terror overwhelms me. The twilight I longed for has been turned into trembling.

5.verse: Set the table, spread out the cloth! Eat! Drink! “Rise up, you princes, oil the shield!”

6.verse: For ADONAI has said to me. “Go, post a watchman— let him declare what he sees!

7.verse: When he sees a chariot with a pair of horsemen, riders on donkeys, riders on camels, let him pay attention— very close attention!”

8.verse: Then he cried out like a lion: “Upon the watch tower, ADONAI, I stand continually in the daytime, and stay at my post every night.

9.verse: Look! Here comes a chariot of men, with a pair of horsemen.” Then one answered and said, “Fallen, fallen is Babylon! All the images of her gods are broken on the ground.”

10.verse: O my people, crushed on the threshing floor, what I heard from ADONAI Tzva’ot, God of Israel, I have declared to you.

11.verse: The burden of Dumah: One calls to me from Seir, “Watchman, what is left of the night? Watchman, what is left of the night?”

12.verse: The watchman said, “Morning comes, yet also it is night.” If you would inquire, inquire. Come back again.”

13.verse: The burden of Arabia: In the desert brush of Arabia you will stay for the night, you caravans of Dedanites.

14.verse: To him who is thirsty bring water, inhabitants of the land of Tema, meet the fugitive with food.

15.verse: For they fled from swords, from drawn sword, from bent bow and distress of war.

16.verse: For thus ADONAI said to me, “Within a year (as with the years of a hired worker), all the glory of Kedar will cease,

17.verse: and the remainder of the number of the archers, the mighty men of the sons of Kedar, will be few. For ADONAI God of Israel has spoken.”

1.verse: Vision of Jerusalem’s Catastrophe - The burden of the Valley of Vision: What is the matter with you now? For you have gone up to the rooftops.

2.verse: You were full of noise, a boisterous city, an exultant town? Your dead were not slain with the sword, nor dead in battle.

3.verse: All your rulers have fled together, then captured without a bow. All who were caught were taken into exile together, though they had fled far off.

4.verse: Therefore I said, “Look away from me! Let me weep bitterly— don’t try to comfort me about the ruin of the daughter of my people.”

5.verse: For my Lord ADONAI-Tzva’ot has a day of panic, trampling and confusion— in the Valley of Vision— of tearing down a wall, a catastrophe on the mountain.

6.verse: Elam took up the quiver, with chariots of men and horsemen, and Kir uncovered the shield.

7.verse: So it will come to pass that your choicest valleys will be full of chariots and horsemen posted at the gate.

8.verse: So He will expose Judah’s defense, and in that day you will look for the armor in the Forest House.

9.verse: Then you will see the breaches in the walls of the city of David—for they will be many—though you collect the water of the lower pool.

10.verse: Though you counted the houses of Jerusalem, you broke down the houses to fortify the wall.

11.verse: You even made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool—but you did not look to the Maker, or consider the One who planned it long before.

12.verse: Now in that day, ADONAI Elohei-Tzva’ot will call for weeping and wailing, for baldness and putting on sackcloth.

13.verse: But instead, there is joy and gladness, slaughtering cattle and killing sheep, meat and drinking wine! “Let’s eat and drink, for tomorrow we will die!”

14.verse: But ADONAI-Tzva’ot revealed in my ears: “Surely this sin will not be atoned for until you die,” says my Lord ADONAI-Tzva’ot.

15.verse: Thus says my Lord ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “Go, say to this steward, to Shebna, who is over the house:

16.verse: ‘What are you doing here, and who are you to be here, that you cut out a grave for yourself, carving out a tomb on the height, chiseling a crypt for yourself in the rock?

17.verse: Behold, strong man, ADONAI is about to hurl you headlong, and seize you firmly.

18.verse: He will roll you up tightly and toss you like a ball into a large country. There you will die, and your glorious chariots will be the shame of your Master’s house.

19.verse: I will remove you from your post, and pull you down from your station.

20.verse: “In that day I will summon my servant Eliakim, son of Hilkiah.

21.verse: I will clothe him in your robe and fasten your sash on him. I will give your authority into his hands, so he will be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and to the house of Judah.

22.verse: I will set the key of the house of David upon his shoulder—what he opens, no one can shut; what he shuts, and no one can open.

23.verse: I will fasten him as a peg in a firm place, and he will be a throne of honor to his father’s house.

24.verse: They will hang all the glory of his father’s house on him—offspring and posterity, all the small vessels, from bowls to all the jars.

25.verse: “In that day,” says ADONAI-Tzva’ot, “the peg that was fastened in a firm place will give way, break away and fall, and the load that was on it will be cut off.” For ADONAI has spoken.

1.verse: Shaking Tyre and Sidon - The burden of Tyre. Wail, ships of Tarshish! For Tyre is destroyed. There is no house and no harbor. From the land of Cyprus, it was revealed to them.

2.verse: Be still, inhabitants of the coastland, you merchants of Sidon, your messengers crossing the sea.

3.verse: On many waters the grain of Shihor, the harvest of the Nile was her revenue and a marketplace of nations.

4.verse: Be ashamed, O Sidon. For the sea has spoken, the stronghold of the sea, saying, “I have not writhed or given birth. I have not reared young men or brought up maidens.”

5.verse: When the report reaches Egypt, they will be in anguish at the report about Tyre.

6.verse: Cross over to Tarshish. Wail, you inhabitants of the island!

7.verse: Is this your jubilant city? Whose antiquity is from long ago, whose feet have taken her to settle in far off lands?

8.verse: Who planned this against Tyre, the crowning city, whose merchants were princes, whose traders were the honored of earth?

9.verse: ADONAI-Tzva’ot has planned it, to defile the pride of all glory, to shame all the honored of earth.

10.verse: Overflow through your land like the Nile, O daughter of Tarshish! There is no restraint any more.

11.verse: His hand has stretched out over the sea, He has shaken the kingdoms. ADONAI has given a commandment concerning Canaan, to destroy its strongholds.

12.verse: He said, “You will exult no more.” O crushed virgin daughter of Sidon. Arise, cross over to Cyprus— even there you will have no rest.

13.verse: Look, the land of the Chaldeans— this is the people who no longer exist. Assyria set it up for desert animals. They set up their siege towers; they stripped its palaces; they made it a ruin.

14.verse: Wail, you ships of Tarshish! For your stronghold is destroyed.

15.verse: Then it will come about in that day that Tyre will be forgotten for 70 years, like the days of one king. At the end of 70 years it will happen to Tyre just as in the song of the prostitute:

16.verse: “Take a harp, stroll about the city, forgotten harlot! Skillfully play many songs, so you may be remembered.”

17.verse: Then it will come about after the end of 70 years that ADONAI will take note of Tyre. She will return to her trade and will prostitute herself with all the kingdoms of the world on the face of the earth.

18.verse: Yet her profit and her wages will be set apart to ADONAI. They will not be stored up or hoarded. For her profit will be for those who dwell in the presence of ADONAI, as ample food and as fine clothing.

1.verse: Curse of Empty Land - Behold, ADONAI makes the land empty and makes it waste, twists its face, and scatters its inhabitants.

2.verse: So it shall be: as with the people, so with the kohen, as with a servant, so with his master, as with a maid, so with her mistress, as with a buyer, so with the seller, as with a lender, so with the borrower, as with a creditor, so with the debtor.

3.verse: The land will be utterly emptied, and totally plundered. For ADONAI has spoken this word.

4.verse: The land faints and fades away, The world wilts and fades away, The exalted people of the earth wilt.

5.verse: The land is polluted by its inhabitants, for they have transgressed Torah, violated statutes, and broken the everlasting covenant.

6.verse: Therefore a curse will devour the land. Those dwelling there are found guilty. Therefore the inhabitants of the land will be burned up, so the people remaining are few.

7.verse: The new wine fails, the vine wilts, all the merry-hearted sigh.

8.verse: The glee of tambourines stops, the noise of revelers ends, the joy of the harp ceases.

9.verse: They no longer drink wine with song. Liquor is bitter to those drinking it.

10.verse: The shattered city is in chaos. Every house is shut up, none may enter.

11.verse: In the streets is an outcry for wine; all joy becomes dark as evening; the mirth of the land is banished.

12.verse: The city is left in ruins; the gate is battered down.

13.verse: Last Days’ Judgments - So will it be in the earth and among the nations, as when shaking an olive tree, or as when gleanings are left after the grape harvest.

14.verse: They will raise their voices, They will sing for joy, of the majesty of ADONAI they shout from the sea.

15.verse: ‘Therefore glorify ADONAI in the east, the Name of ADONAI, the God of Israel, in the isles of the sea.

16.verse: From the ends of the earth we have heard songs: “Glory to the righteous!” But I say, “I waste away, I waste away! Oy to me! Traitors betray! With treachery traitors betray!”

17.verse: Panic, pit and trap are upon you, O inhabitant of the earth.

18.verse: And it shall come to pass: whoever flees from the sound of panic will fall in the pit, and whoever climbs up out of the pit will be caught in the trap. For the windows of heaven are opened and the foundations of the earth shake.

19.verse: The earth is broken apart, the earth is split open, the earth is shaken utterly.

20.verse: The earth reels to and fro like a drunk, and sways like a hut. its transgression is so heavy upon it that it will fall and never rise again.

21.verse: It will come about in that day, ADONAI will punish the host of heaven on high, and the kings of the earth on the earth.

22.verse: They will be gathered together, like prisoners in the Pit, and will be shut up in the prison, and after many days be punished.

23.verse: Then the moon will be abashed and the sun ashamed, for ADONAI-Tzva’ot will reign on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, and before His elders, gloriously.

1.verse: Last Days’ Deliverance - ADONAI, You are my God, I will exalt You, I will praise Your Name, for You have done wonderful things, plans of old with steadfast faithfulness.

2.verse: For You have made a city into a heap, a fortified city into a ruin, a foreigner’s palace a city no more— never to be rebuilt.

3.verse: Therefore a strong people will honor You. Cities of ruthless nations will fear You.

4.verse: For You have been a stronghold for the poor, a stronghold for the needy in distress, a refuge from the rainstorm, a shade from the heat. For the breath of the ruthless is like a storm against the wall.

5.verse: Like heat in a dry place, You subdue the roar of foreigners. Like heat in the shade of a cloud, the song of tyrants is brought low.

6.verse: On this mountain, ADONAI-Tzva’ot will prepare a lavish banquet for all peoples— a banquet of aged wine— of rich food, of choice marrow, of aged wine well refined.

7.verse: On this mountain He will swallow up the shroud that enfolds all peoples, the veil spread over all nations.

8.verse: He will swallow up death forever. my Lord ADONAI will wipe away tears from every face. He will remove His people’s reproach from all the earth. For ADONAI has spoken.

9.verse: It will be said in that day: “Behold, this is our God, We waited for Him—He will save us. This is ADONAI—we waited for Him. We will rejoice and be glad in His salvation.”

10.verse: For the hand of ADONAI will rest on this mountain. Moab will be trampled under Him, as straw is trampled in a manure pile.

11.verse: When he spreads his hands in it as a swimmer spreads his hands to swim, his pride will be brought down low together with the trickery of his hands.

12.verse: He will level your high-fortified walls, lay them low, and cast them down to the ground, down to dust.

1.verse: Trust the Rock of Ages - In that day, this song will be sung in the land of Judah: “We have a strong city. He appoints salvation as its walls and ramparts.

2.verse: Open the gates! Let the righteous nation enter— one that keeps faith.

3.verse: You keep in perfect peace one whose mind is stayed on You, because he trusts in You.

4.verse: Trust in ADONAI forever, for the LORD ADONAI is a Rock of ages.

5.verse: For He humbles those dwelling on high, leveling the lofty city, leveling it to the ground, bringing it down to the dust.

6.verse: Feet will trample it down, feet of the afflicted, the footsteps of the poor.

7.verse: The way of the righteous is straight. Upright One, You make smooth the path of the righteous.

8.verse: Yes, in the way of Your judgments, ADONAI, we have waited for You. Your Name and Your remembrance is the desire of our soul.

9.verse: My soul longs for You at night, yes, my spirit within me seeks You. For when Your judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.

10.verse: Though grace is shown to the wicked, he does not learn righteousness. Even in a land of uprightness he will act wrongly, not perceiving the majesty of ADONAI.

11.verse: ADONAI, Your hand is lifted up, yet they do not see it; They will see Your zeal for the people and be put to shame. Yes, fire will devour Your enemies.

12.verse: Your Dead Will Live! - ADONAI, You will establish shalom for us, for all our works You have done for us.

13.verse: ADONAI Eloheinu, other lords beside You have had dominion over us, but we remember Your Name alone.

14.verse: The dead do not live— dead souls do not rise. Thus You punished and destroyed them and wiped out all memory of them.

15.verse: You have increased the nation, ADONAI, You have increased the nation. You are glorified as You have expanded all the borders of the land.

16.verse: ADONAI, they sought You in distress, they poured out a whispered prayer when Your discipline was upon them.

17.verse: As a pregnant woman about to give birth writhes and cries out in her pain, so we were before You, ADONAI.

18.verse: We have been with child, we have been in pain, yet we gave birth to wind. We are accomplishing no deliverance for the earth, nor are inhabitants of the world coming to life.

19.verse: Yet it will be: “Your dead will live! My corpses will rise! Awake and shout for joy, you who dwell in the dust! Your dew is like the dew of the dawn. The land of dead souls will come to life!

20.verse: Go, my people, enter your rooms, and shut your doors behind you. Hide for a little while, until the wrath is past.

21.verse: For behold, ADONAI is coming out from His place to punish inhabitants of the earth for iniquity. The earth will disclose her bloodshed, no longer covering up her slain.

1.verse: Leviathan the Dragon - In that day ADONAI will punish Leviathan the fleeing serpent with His fierce, great, strong sword, Leviathan the twisted serpent! He will slay the dragon in the sea.

2.verse: Second Song of the Vineyard - “In that day sing to her, ‘A vineyard of delight!’

3.verse: I, ADONAI, watch over it, I water it every moment. I guard it day and night, so that no one may harm it.

4.verse: It is not that I have wrath. Who would give me thorns and thistles? Into battle I would march against them! I would burn them up altogether!

5.verse: Rather let them rely on My strength. Let them make peace with Me— make peace with Me.”

6.verse: Israel Will Blossom Again - In days to come Jacob will take root, Israel will blossom and bud and fill the face of the world with fruit.

7.verse: Did He strike Israel as He struck those who struck them? Or were they slain as their slayers were slain?

8.verse: You contended with her by banishing her, by driving her away. With His fierce wind He expelled them on the day of the east wind.

9.verse: So by this will Jacob’s sin be atoned and this the full price to remove his sin: When he makes all the altar stones like shattered chalk stones, so that the Asherah poles and incense rise no more.

10.verse: The fortified city is a lonely habitation, forlorn and forsaken like the desert. There the calf will graze, there lie down and consume its branches.

11.verse: When the boughs are withered, they will be broken off. Women come and set them on fire, for it is a people of no understanding. Therefore their Maker will show them no mercy— He who formed them will give them no grace.

12.verse: It will come about in that day, ADONAI will thresh from the channel of the River to the Wadi of Egypt, and you will be gathered one by one, Bnei-Yisrael.

13.verse: It will also come about in that day, a great shofar will be blown. Those perishing in the land of Assyria and the exiles in the land of Egypt will come and worship ADONAI on the holy mountain in Jerusalem.

1.verse: A Cornerstone of Zion - Oy, the proud crown of Ephraim’s drunks! Its glorious beauty is a fading flower, which is at the head of the fertile valleys of those overcome with wine!

2.verse: Behold, ADONAI is strong and mighty, like a hailstorm, a destructive tempest, like a downpour of overflowing water, He hurls it down to earth with His hand.

3.verse: The proud crown of Ephraim’s drunks will be trampled underfoot.

4.verse: The glorious beauty is a fading flower which is at the head of the fertile valley, like a first-ripe fig before summer— whoever sees it, swallows it up while it is still in his palm.

5.verse: In that day ADONAI-Tzva’ot will be a crown of glory, a diadem of beauty to the remnant of His people,

6.verse: a spirit of judgment for him who sits on the judgment seat, and strength for those turning back the battle at the gate.

7.verse: But these also reel from wine and stagger from strong drink —the kohen and the prophet reel from strong drink— are confused because of wine, they stagger because of strong drink, they are muddled in vision, they stumble in judgment.

8.verse: Since all the tables are full of the filth of vomit, no place is left.

9.verse: To whom will He teach knowledge? To whom will He explain the message? Those just weaned from milk? Those just taken from the breast?

10.verse: For it must be ‘precept upon precept, precept upon precept, line upon line, line upon line, here a little, there a little.’

11.verse: For through stammering lips and a foreign tongue He will speak to this people,

12.verse: To whom He said, “Here is rest, give rest to the weary, here is repose”—but they would not listen.

13.verse: So the word of ADONAI is to them ‘precept on precept, precept on precept, line upon line, line upon line, here a little, there a little.’ So they walk, and fall backward, and are broken, trapped, and captured.

14.verse: Therefore hear the word of ADONAI, you scoffers, who rule this people who are in Jerusalem:

15.verse: “Because you have said, ‘We cut a covenant with death, we made a pact with Sheol, so when the overflowing scourge passes through, it won’t come for us, for we have made lies our refuge, and hid ourselves in falsehood’—

16.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI Elohim: ‘Behold, I am laying in Zion a stone, a tested stone, a costly cornerstone, a firm foundation— whoever trusts will not flee in haste.

17.verse: But I will make justice the measuring line and righteousness the plumb line. Hail will sweep away the refuge of lies, and water will overflow the hiding place.

18.verse: Your covenant with death is annulled, and your pact with Sheol will not stand. An overflowing scourge will pass through and you will be its trampling place.

19.verse: As often as it passes through, it will seize you— morning by morning, by day and by night passing through. It will be sheer terror to understand the message.’”

20.verse: For too short is the bed to stretch on, too narrow the blanket to wrap up in.

21.verse: For ADONAI will rise up as at Mount Perazim, He will quake with awe as at the valley of Gibeon, to do His deed, His strange deed, and to work His work, His extraordinary work.

22.verse: So now, stop your scoffing, lest your shackles be strengthened! For I have heard from ADONAI Elohei-Tzva’ot of destruction determined upon the whole land.

23.verse: Give ear and hear my voice! Pay attention and hear my words.

24.verse: Does a plowman plow all day to sow the seed? Does he continually break open and harrow his ground?

25.verse: No! When he has leveled its surface, he scatters dill and sows cumin, plants wheat in rows, places barley, and rye on its border.

26.verse: For his God teaches him judgment, instructing him.

27.verse: For dill is not threshed with a sledge, nor is a cart wheel rolled over cumin. Rather, dill is beaten out with a staff, and cumin with a rod.

28.verse: Bread grain is crushed, but not endlessly. Rumbling cart wheels and horses over it would only crush it to powder.

29.verse: This also comes from ADONAI-Tzva’ot: Wonderful is His counsel, great is His wisdom.

1.verse: Night Vision of Ariel - Oy, Ariel, Ariel! City where David camped. Year to year again—festivals in a cycle.

2.verse: But I will distress Ariel. There will be lamenting and moaning— then will she be like Ariel to Me?

3.verse: I will encamp against you all around, I will set up siege-works against you and will raise up ramps against you.

4.verse: You will be brought low, you will speak from the ground. From the dust where you are prostrate your speech will come. Your voice will be like a ghost out of the ground, and your speech will whisper out of the dust.

5.verse: Yet the multitude of your foes will become like fine dust, and the multitude of the terrifying like chaff that passes away. It will happen in an instant, suddenly.

6.verse: You will be visited by ADONAI-Tzva’ot with thunder, earthquake, huge noise, whirlwind and storm-wind, and the flame of a consuming fire.

7.verse: It will be like a dream, a night vision: the multitude of all the nations warring against Ariel, yes, all warring against her, the ramparts around her and her besiegers.

8.verse: It will be like a hungry man dreaming and behold, he is eating, but awakes with his hunger unsatisfied, or like a thirsty man dreaming and behold, he is drinking, but awakes faint, his soul thirsting. So it will be with the multitude of all the nations warring against Mount Zion.

9.verse: Wait, and be astounded! Blind yourselves, and be blind! Drunk, but not with wine, Stagger, but not with strong drink.

10.verse: For ADONAI has poured out on you a spirit of deep sleep, and has shut your eyes—the prophets, and covered your heads—the seers.

11.verse: So this entire vision is for you like the words of a sealed scroll, which they give to one who knows books, saying, “Read this, please,” but he says, “I can’t, because it’s sealed.”

12.verse: Then the scroll is given to one who does not know books, saying, “Read this, please,” but he says, “I don’t know books.”

13.verse: So ADONAI says, “Since these people draw near with their mouths and honor Me with their lips, yet their hearts are far from Me, and their fear of Me is a mitzvah taught by men.

14.verse: Therefore, behold, once more I will do a marvelous work among this people— a marvel and a wonder— so the wisdom of their wise will perish, and the discernment of their discerning will be concealed.”

15.verse: Oy, those who go to great depths to hide their plans from ADONAI! Their works are in the dark. They say, “Who sees us? Who knows us?”

16.verse: Your perversity! Should the potter be regarded the same as the clay? Should the thing made say to its maker, “You did not make me”? Or the thing formed say of its former, “You have no understanding?”

17.verse: Will it not be just a very little while before Lebanon turns into a garden, and a garden will seem like a forest?

18.verse: In that day the deaf will hear words of a book, and out of gloom and darkness the eyes of the blind will see.

19.verse: The meek will add to their joy in ADONAI, and the needy of humanity will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.

20.verse: For the ruthless will come to an end and the scorner will be finished, and all watching to do evil cut off.

21.verse: Those who make a man out to be guilty with a word, and trap him who reproves at the gate, and deny justice with meaninglessness.

22.verse: Therefore, thus says ADONAI, Redeemer of Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob: “Jacob will no longer be ashamed, no longer will his face grow pale;

23.verse: for when he sees his children, the work of My hands in his midst, they will sanctify My Name; they will sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and stand in awe of the God of Israel.

24.verse: Those who go astray in spirit will come to understanding, and those who murmur will learn instruction.”

1.verse: No Help In Egypt - “Oy, the rebellious children” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “Who carry out a plan, but not Mine, and make an alliance, but not of My Ruach, so they may add sin to sin,

2.verse: who go down to Egypt, but did not consult Me, to take refuge in Pharaoh’s stronghold, to seek shelter in Egypt’s shadow.
