3.verse: Therefore Pharaoh’s stronghold will become your shame, and the shelter in Egypt’s shadow will become your disgrace.

4.verse: For though their princes are at Zoan and their ambassadors reach Hanes,

5.verse: they will all be ashamed of a people who cannot profit them. They are neither help nor profit, but shame and disgrace.”

6.verse: The burden concerning the beasts of the Negev: Through a land of trouble and anguish, in which are lioness and lion, viper and flying serpent, they are carrying their riches on the backs of young donkeys, their treasures on camel humps, to a people who cannot profit them.

7.verse: Egypt’s help is futile and pointless. Therefore I have called her “Rahab who just sits.”

8.verse: Witness Against False Prophets - Now go, write it on a tablet for them and inscribe it in a scroll, so that it may be as a witness for the last day, forever.

9.verse: For this is a rebellious people, lying children, children unwilling to obey the Torah of ADONAI.

10.verse: They say to the seers, “Do not see,” and to the prophets, “Do not prophesy to us what is right. Speak to us smooth words. Prophesy illusions.

11.verse: Get out of the way! Turn away from the path! Let’s hear no more about the Holy One of Israel.”

12.verse: Therefore thus says the Holy One of Israel: “Because you despise this word, and trust in oppression and rely on perversity,

13.verse: therefore this sin will be to you like a crack bulging in a high wall, about to fall— its collapse comes suddenly, in an instant!

14.verse: Its collapse is like smashing a clay jar, so ruthlessly shattered that a shard will not be found among the pieces to take fire from the hearth or scoop water from the cistern.”

15.verse: Longing to Be Gracious - For thus says ADONAI Elohim, the Holy One of Israel: “By repentance and rest you are saved, in quietness and trust is your strength— but you were not willing.”

16.verse: But you said, “No, we will flee on horses!” Therefore you will flee. And, “We will ride on swift horses!” Therefore your pursuers will be swift.

17.verse: A thousand will flee at the threat of one, at the threat of five you will flee, until you are left like a flag on the top of a mountain, and like a banner on a hill.

18.verse: Therefore ADONAI is longing to be gracious to you. Thus He will be exalted, so He may have mercy on you. For ADONAI is a God of justice. Blessed are all who wait for Him.

19.verse: For the people of Zion who are dwelling in Jerusalem will weep no more. He will surely be gracious to you at the sound of your cry. When He hears you, He will answer.

20.verse: Though ADONAI gives you the bread of adversity and the water of oppression, your teachers will no longer be hidden, but your eyes will see your teachers.

21.verse: Your ears will hear a word behind you saying: “This is the way, walk in it. When you turn to the right, or when you turn to the left.”

22.verse: You will defile your graven images overlaid with silver, and your metal images covered with gold. You will throw them away like a menstrual cloth. You will say, “Be gone!”

23.verse: Then He will give you rain for your seed, which you will sow in the ground, and bread, the produce of the ground, will be rich and plentiful. In that day your cattle will feed in wide-open pasture.

24.verse: The oxen and the young donkeys that till the ground will eat seasoned fodder, which has been winnowed with shovel and pitchfork.

25.verse: There will be, on every high mountain and on every lofty hill, streams running with water— on a day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.

26.verse: Moreover the light of the moon will be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be seven times brighter— like the light of seven days— in the day ADONAI binds up the brokenness of His people, and heals the wounds He inflicted.

27.verse: Look, ADONAI’s Name comes from afar, burning with His anger, in thick rising smoke, His lips full of indignation, His tongue like a consuming fire,

28.verse: His Ruach like an overflowing torrent rising up to the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of the worthless, to put in the jaws of the peoples a bridle that leads away.

29.verse: You will have songs as in the night when you keep a holy festival, and gladness of heart like one walking with the flute to go to the mountain of ADONAI, to the Rock of Israel.

30.verse: Punishing Rod - ADONAI will make His glorious voice heard, and reveal His arm descending with fierce fury in a consuming fire, in cloudburst, rainstorm and hailstones.

31.verse: For at the voice of ADONAI, Assyria will be terrified— when He strikes with the rod.

32.verse: Every stroke of His punishing rod that ADONAI brings down on him —with tambourines and harps, and battles brandishing His arm— He will fight against them.

33.verse: For Topheth has long been ready, prepared for the king, its fire pit made deep and wide, a pyre of fire with plenty of wood. The breath of ADONAI, like a torrent of brimstone, sets it aflame.

1.verse: Egypt’s Horses Will Stumble - Oy, those going down to Egypt for help. They are relying on horses, trusting in chariots since they are many, and in horsemen since they are very mighty, but do not look to the Holy One of Israel nor seek ADONAI!

2.verse: Yet He is also wise. He brings disaster, and does not take back His words. He rises against the house of evildoers, against help for workers of iniquity.

3.verse: Now Egyptians are men and not God, and their horses are flesh, not spirit. When ADONAI stretches out His hand, both he who helps will stumble and he who is helped will fall, and both will perish together.

4.verse: A Lion Protects Zion - For thus says ADONAI to me: “As a lion or a young lion growls over its prey, though a company of shepherds is called out against him —their voice does not disturb him, nor does their noise upset him— so ADONAI-Tzva’ot will come down to fight on Mount Zion, on its hill.

5.verse: Like hovering birds, so ADONAI-Tzva’ot will protect Jerusalem. By protecting, He will deliver. By passing over, He will save.”

6.verse: Return to the One from whom rebellion is so deep, Bnei-Yisrael.

7.verse: For in that day everyone will cast away his idols of silver and his idols of gold, which you made for yourselves with your hands of sin.

8.verse: “Then Assyria will fall, not by a sword of man, so a sword not of man will devour him and he will flee from the sword. His young men will be put to forced labor.

9.verse: His rock will pass away because of fear. His princes will be afraid of the banner” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— His fire is in Zion, and His furnace is in Jerusalem.

1.verse: Reign in Righteousness - Behold, a king will reign in righteousness and princes will rule in justice.

2.verse: Each will be like a refuge from the wind and a shelter from the storm, like streams of water in a dry place, like the shade of a massive rock in a weary land.

3.verse: Then the eyes of those who see will not be closed, and the ears of those who hear will pay attention.

4.verse: The heart of the hasty will understand knowledge, and the tongue of stammerers will speak fluently, clearly.

5.verse: No longer will a fool be called noble, or a scoundrel said to be a gentleman.

6.verse: For the fool speaks foolishness and his heart works wickedness, to practice ungodliness, and speak error about ADONAI, to deprive the hungry of food and withhold drink from the thirsty.

7.verse: The scoundrel’s methods are evil— he makes up wicked schemes to destroy the poor with lies, even when the plea of the needy is just.

8.verse: But the noble devises noble plans, and for noble causes he stands.

9.verse: Rise up, you women at ease, And hear my voice. You complacent daughters, give ear to my words.

10.verse: Within a year and a few days you will shudder, complacent ones. For the grape harvest will fail and the gathering will not come.

11.verse: Tremble, you women at ease! Shudder, you complacent ones! Strip and make yourselves bare, and put sackcloth on your waist.

12.verse: Beat your breasts lamenting for pleasant fields, or fruitful vine,

13.verse: for the land of my people, where thorns and briars come up, for all the joyful houses of the jubilant city.

14.verse: For the palace will be abandoned; the bustling city will be deserted; the citadel and watchtower will become a wasteland forever, a delight of wild donkeys, a pasture for flocks,

15.verse: until the Ruach is poured out on us from on high, and the desert becomes a garden, and a garden seems like a forest.

16.verse: Then justice will dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness abide in the garden.

17.verse: The result of righteousness will be shalom and the effect of righteousness will be quietness and confidence forever.

18.verse: My people will live in a peaceful place, in secure dwellings, quiet resting places.

19.verse: Then hail will flatten the forest; and the city will be utterly laid low.

20.verse: Blessed are you, sowing by all waters, letting the feet of the ox and the donkey range free.

1.verse: Ambassadors of Peace Weep Bitterly - Oy, you destroyer, never destroyed, you traitor, never betrayed! When you have stopped destroying, you will be destroyed; and when you finish betraying, they will betray you.

2.verse: ADONAI, be gracious to us! We long for You. Be our strength every morning, our salvation in time of trouble.

3.verse: From the noise of tumult people will flee; When You lift Yourself up, the nations will be scattered.

4.verse: Your spoil is gathered as the caterpillar gathers; like a swarm of locusts, they are rushing over it.

5.verse: ADONAI is exalted, for He dwells on high! He has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.

6.verse: It will be your time of faithfulness, a wealth of salvation, wisdom and knowledge— the fear of ADONAI is His treasure.

7.verse: Behold, heroes cry outside. Ambassadors of peace weep bitterly.

8.verse: Highways are desolate; travel has ceased; covenant is broken; cities are despised; there is no regard for humanity.

9.verse: The land mourns and languishes; Lebanon is shamed and withers; Sharon is like a wilderness; Bashan and Carmel are shaken bare.

10.verse: Our Eternal Judge Arises - “Now I will arise,” says ADONAI. “Now I will be exalted. Now I will lift Myself up.

11.verse: You conceive chaff, you will give birth to stubble. My breath is a fire that will consume you.

12.verse: Then peoples will be burned as lime, like thorns cut down, burned in the fire.

13.verse: Hear, you who are afar off, what I have done, and you who are near, acknowledge My might.”

14.verse: Sinners in Zion are afraid. Trembling has seized the godless: “Who among us can live with the consuming fire?” “Who among us can live with everlasting burnings?”

15.verse: One who walks righteously, and speaks uprightly, who refuses unjust gain by extortion, who shakes his hands free of bribes, who stops his ears from hearing of bloodshed, and shuts his eyes from looking on evil.

16.verse: He will dwell on the heights— his refuge will be an impregnable cliff. His bread will be provided, his water assured.

17.verse: Your eyes will see the King in His beauty. They will gaze at a far-distant land.

18.verse: Your heart will meditate on terror: “Where is the counter?” “Where is the weigher?” “Where is the counter of towers?”

19.verse: You will no longer see the fierce people, the people of speech too obscure to comprehend, with a stammering tongue no one understands.

20.verse: Look upon Zion, city of our Festivals. Your eyes will see Jerusalem as a quiet home, a tent that will never be folded, Its stakes never pulled up, its cords never broken.

21.verse: For there the majestic One, ADONAI, will be for us— a place of rivers and wide canals, on which no boat with oars will go, nor any mighty ship will travel by.

22.verse: For ADONAI is our Judge, ADONAI is our Lawgiver, ADONAI is our King— He will save us!

23.verse: Your cords hang slack, not holding the mast in place firmly, nor spreading out the sail. Then abundant spoil will be divided— even the lame will carry off plunder.

24.verse: No inhabitant will say, “I am sick.” The people dwelling there will be forgiven their iniquity.

1.verse: End-Time Vision - Draw near, O nations, to hear, and listen, O peoples! Let the earth hear, and all it contains, the world, and all its offspring!

2.verse: For ADONAI is enraged at all the nations, and furious at all their armies. He will utterly destroy them. He will give them over to slaughter.

3.verse: So their slain will be thrown out, and the stench of their corpses will rise, and the hills will be drenched with their blood.

4.verse: Then all the host of heaven will dissolve, and the skies will be rolled up like a scroll— so all their array will wither away, like a leaf drooping from a vine, like a fig shriveling from a fig tree.

5.verse: Seek the Scroll and Read - For My sword has drunk its fill in the heavens. See, it will come down upon Edom, upon the people I have devoted to judgment.

6.verse: The sword of ADONAI is filled with blood, gorged with fat— the blood of lambs and goats, the fat of kidneys of rams. For ADONAI has a sacrifice in Bozrah, a great slaughter in the land of Edom.

7.verse: Wild oxen will go down with them, bull calves with mighty steers. So their land will be soaked with blood and their dust greasy with fat.

8.verse: For ADONAI has a day of vengeance, a year of recompense for the hostility against Zion.

9.verse: Its streams will be turned into pitch, its dust into brimstone, and its land will become burning tar.

10.verse: It will not be quenched night or day. Its smoke will go up forever. From generation to generation it will lay waste— forever and ever none will pass through it.

11.verse: But pelican and porcupine will have it, owl and raven will dwell in it. He will stretch a line of chaos over it and stones of desolation.

12.verse: As for its nobles, there are none there to call it a kingdom, and all its princes will come to nothing.

13.verse: Thorns will come up in its palaces, nettles and thistles in its fortresses. It will be a haunt of jackals, an abode for ostriches.

14.verse: Wildcats will meet with wolves, the goat-demon will cry to its kind— yes, the night monster will settle there and find itself a resting place.

15.verse: A tree snake will nest and lay eggs there, hatch and gather them under its shadow. Surely, hawks are gathered there, each one with her mate.

16.verse: Seek from the scroll of ADONAI, and read! Not one of them will be missing; none will lack its mate. For His mouth commanded it, and His Ruach gathered them.

17.verse: He cast the lot for them, and His hand divided it out to them with the line. They will possess it forever, and dwell in it from generation to generation.

1.verse: Highway in the Wilderness - The wilderness and dry land will be glad. The desert will rejoice and blossom like a lily.

2.verse: It will blossom profusely, will rejoice with joy and singing, will be given the glory of Lebanon, the splendor of Carmel and Sharon. They will see the glory of ADONAI, the splendor of our God.

3.verse: Strengthen the limp hands, make firm the wobbly knees.

4.verse: Say to those with anxious heart, “Be strong, have no fear!” Behold, your God! Vengeance is coming! God’s recompense—it is coming! Then He will save you.

5.verse: Then the eyes of the blind will be opened and the ears of the deaf unstopped.

6.verse: Then the lame will leap like a deer, and the tongue of the mute will sing. For water will burst forth in the desert and streams in the wilderness.

7.verse: The parched land will become a pool, the thirsty ground springs of water. In the haunt of jackals, where they rest, grass will become reeds and rushes.

8.verse: A highway will be there—a roadway. It will be called the Way of Holiness. The unclean will not travel on it. It is for the one who walks the way. Fools will not go astray.

9.verse: No lion will be there. No ravenous beast will go up on it. They will not be found there. But the redeemed will walk there.

10.verse: The ransomed of ADONAI will return and come to Zion with singing, with everlasting joy upon their heads. They will obtain gladness and joy, and sorrow and sighing will flee away.

1.verse: Sennacherib Dares Jerusalem - Now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah that King Sennacherib of Assyria came up against all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.

2.verse: The king of Assyria sent the Rab-shakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem to King Hezekiah with a massive army. The Rab-shakeh stood by the aqueduct of the upper pool in the highway of the washer’s field.

3.verse: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder came out to him.

4.verse: So the Rab-shakeh said to them, “Say now to Hezekiah, thus says the great king, the king of Assyria: ‘What is this confidence you’ve relied on?

5.verse: I say your strategy and strength for war are only words of a lip. Who do you rely on now, so that you have rebelled against me?

6.verse: Behold, you rely on this splintered reed as a staff—Egypt! If a man leans on it, it will go into the palm of his hand and pierce it—thus Pharaoh king of Egypt is to all who trust in him.

7.verse: “‘But if you say to me: ‘We trust in ADONAI our God’—is it not He whose high places and altars Hezekiah has removed, and then said to Judah and to Jerusalem, ‘You must worship before this altar’?

8.verse: “So now, make a bargain with my master, the king of Assyria. I’ll give you 2,000 horses—if you could put riders of your own on them.

9.verse: So, how can you repulse a single lieutenant—the least of my master’s servants? Yes, you’re relying on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen.

10.verse: “Moreover, have I now come up against this land to destroy it without ADONAI’s approval? ADONAI said to me: ‘Go up against this land, and destroy it.’”

11.verse: Then Eliakim and Shebna and Joah said to the Rab-shakeh: “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it. Don’t speak to us in the language of the Jews when the people on the wall are listening.”

12.verse: But the Rab-shakeh said: “Has my master sent me only to your master and to you to speak these words? Hasn’t he sent me to the men who sit on the wall—who will eat their own waste and drink their own urine with you?”

13.verse: Then the Rab-shakeh stood and cried with a loud voice in the language of the Jews and said: “Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.

14.verse: Thus says the king: ‘Don’t let Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to deliver you!

15.verse: Nor let Hezekiah persuade you to trust in ADONAI by saying, “ADONAI will surely deliver us—this city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.”’

16.verse: “Don’t listen to Hezekiah! For thus says the king of Assyria: ‘Make peace with me and come out to me. Then everyone will eat from his own vine and fig tree, and everyone will drink water from his own cistern,

17.verse: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land—a land of grain and wine, a land of bread and vineyards.’

18.verse: “Beware that Hezekiah does not mislead you by saying, ‘ADONAI will deliver us.’ Has any one of the gods of the nations delivered his land from the hand of the king of Assyria?

19.verse: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Indeed, when did they deliver Samaria from my hand?

20.verse: Who among all the gods of these lands have delivered their country out of my hand? So will ADONAI deliver Jerusalem from my hand?”

21.verse: But they were silent, and did not answer him a word, for the king’s commandment was, “Do not answer him.”

22.verse: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who was in charge of the palace, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn, and told him the words of the Rab-shakeh.

1.verse: Hezekiah Tears His Clothes - When King Hezekiah heard it, he tore his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the House of ADONAI.

2.verse: Then he sent Eliakim, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the scribe and the senior kohanim, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, son of Amoz.

3.verse: Then they said to him: “Thus says Hezekiah: This day is a day of distress, rebuke and contempt. For children have come to the point of birth, and there is no strength for giving birth.

4.verse: Perhaps ADONAI your God, will hear the words of the Rab-shakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to mock the living God, and will rebuke the words which ADONAI your God has heard. So offer prayer for the remnant that is left.”

5.verse: When the officials of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah,

6.verse: Isaiah said to them: “Thus you will say to your master, ‘Thus says ADONAI: Do not be afraid of the words you have heard, with which the boys of the king of Assyria have blasphemed Me.

7.verse: Behold, I am putting a spirit in him so that he will hear a rumor, and will return to his own country; then I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.’”

8.verse: Then the Rab-shakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria fighting against Libnah, for he had heard he had withdrawn from Lachish.

9.verse: Now he had heard them say concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, saying: “He has come out to fight against you.” When he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah saying:

10.verse: “Thus you will say to King Hezekiah of Judah, saying, do not let your God in whom you trust deceive you, saying: ‘Jerusalem will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.’

11.verse: Behold, you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands—utterly destroying them—so will you be delivered?

12.verse: Have the gods of the nations delivered those my fathers destroyed—Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, or the children of Eden who were in Telassar?

13.verse: Where is the king of Hamath, or the king of Arpad, or the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena, or Ivvah?’”

14.verse: Then Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers and read it. Then Hezekiah went up to the House of ADONAI and spread it before ADONAI.

15.verse: Hezekiah prayed to ADONAI saying:

16.verse: “ADONAI-Tzva’ot, God of Israel, who is enthroned upon the cheruvim, You alone are God of all the kingdoms of the earth. You have made heaven and earth.

17.verse: Incline Your ear, ADONAI, and hear! Open Your eyes, ADONAI, and see! Listen to all the words of Sennacherib, who was sent to mock the living God.

18.verse: It is true, ADONAI, the kings of Assyria have devastated all the countries and their lands,

19.verse: and have cast their gods into the fire—for they were not gods, but the work of human hands, wood and stone. So they have destroyed them.

20.verse: Now, ADONAI our God, save us from his hand, so that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that You alone are ADONAI!”

21.verse: Answered Prayer and Sennacherib’s Demise - Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent word to Hezekiah saying, “Thus says ADONAI, the God of Israel: ‘Because you prayed to Me about King Sennacherib of Assyria,

22.verse: this is the word that ADONAI has spoken about him: “The virgin Daughter of Zion will despise you and mock you. The daughter of Jerusalem will shake her head at you.

23.verse: Whom did you taunt and blaspheme? Against whom did you raise your voice and haughtily lift up your eyes? Against the Holy One of Israel!

24.verse: Through your servants, you have blasphemed my Lord and said: ‘With my many chariots I have climbed to the heights of the mountains, to the remotest parts of Lebanon! I cut down its tall cedars and choice cypress trees. I have gone to its farthest peak, its thickest forest.

25.verse: I dug and drank water, and with the sole of my feet, I dried up all the streams of Egypt.’

26.verse: Have you not heard? I did it long ago! From ancient times I planned it. Now I have brought it to pass— that you should turn fortified cities into heaps of rubble.

27.verse: Their inhabitants are weak handed, shattered and ashamed. They are like the grass of the field and green herb, like grass on roofs, scorched before it is grown up.

28.verse: But I know your sitting down, your going out and your coming in, and your raging against Me.

29.verse: Because your raging against Me and your arrogance reached My ears, I will put My hook in your nose, and My bridle in your lips, and I will turn you back by the way that you came.”

30.verse: So this shall be the sign to you: This year you will eat what grows by itself, in the second year what springs from that. But in the third year, you will sow, reap, plant vineyards, and eat their fruit.

31.verse: The surviving remnant of the house of Judah will take root downward and bear fruit upward.

32.verse: For from Jerusalem a remnant will go out, and survivors from Mount Zion. The zeal of ADONAI-Tzva’ot shall perform this.”

33.verse: Therefore thus says ADONAI concerning the king of Assyria: “He will not come to the city, or shoot an arrow there, or come before it with a shield, or throw up a siege-ramp against it.

34.verse: By the way that he came, by the same he will return, and he will not come into this city” —it is a declaration of ADONAI.

35.verse: “For I will defend this city to save it, for My own sake, and for My servant David’s sake.”

36.verse: Then the angel of ADONAI went out and struck down 185,000 men in the Assyrian camp. When the men arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.

37.verse: So King Sennacherib of Assyria withdrew, and returned home, and stayed in Nineveh.

38.verse: It also came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of his god Nisroch, that his sons Adrammelech and Sarezer struck him down with the sword, and escaped into the land of Ararat. Then his son Esarhaddon became king in his place.

1.verse: “Put Your House In Order” - In those days Hezekiah became mortally ill. So Isaiah the prophet son of Amoz came to him and said to him, “Thus says ADONAI: Put your house in order. For you are dying, and will not live.”

2.verse: Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall, and prayed to ADONAI.

3.verse: He said: “Please, ADONAI, remember how I have walked before You in truth and with a whole heart, and have done what is good in Your eyes.” And Hezekiah wept bitterly.

4.verse: Then it came to pass, the word of ADONAI came to Isaiah saying:

5.verse: “Go, and say to Hezekiah, thus says ADONAI, the God of your father David: ‘I have heard your prayer and I have seen your tears. Behold, I will add 15 years to your life.

6.verse: I will deliver you and this city from the hand of the king of Assyria; I will defend this city.’

7.verse: “Now this will be the sign to you from ADONAI, that ADONAI will do this word He has spoken:

8.verse: Behold, I will cause the shadow on the stairs, which went down with the sun on the sundial of Ahaz, to turn back ten steps.” So the sun’s shadow went back ten steps on the sundial on which it had gone down.

9.verse: A writing of King Hezekiah of Judah, after his illness, when he recovered from his illness:

10.verse: I said: “In the prime of my life, I am to enter the gates of Sheol. I am deprived of the rest of my years.”

11.verse: I said: “I will not see ADONAI, ADONAI, in the land of the living. I will look on humanity no longer among the inhabitants of the world.

12.verse: Like a shepherd’s tent, my dwelling is pulled up and carried away from me. Like a weaver I rolled up my life. He cuts me off from the loom. From day until night You make my end.

13.verse: I stilled my soul till morning. Like a lion, He will break all my bones. From day till night You make my end.

14.verse: Like a swallow or a crane, I whisper, I moan like a dove. My eyes are weary, looking upward. ADONAI, I am oppressed, be my security!

15.verse: What should I say? For He has spoken to me— He Himself has done it! I will wander about all my years because of the bitterness of my soul.

16.verse: ADONAI, by such things men live, and my spirit has life in them too. Restore me to health, and let me live!

17.verse: Behold, it was for my own shalom that I had great bitterness. You have loved my soul out of the Pit of destruction! For You have flung all my sins behind Your back.

18.verse: For Sheol cannot thank You, death cannot praise You. Those who go down to the Pit cannot hope for Your faithfulness.

19.verse: The living, the living—they praise You— as I do today. A father makes Your faithfulness known to his children.

20.verse: ADONAI will save me. So we will play my songs on stringed instruments all the days of our life in the House of ADONAI.”

21.verse: Now Isaiah had said, “Let them take a cake of figs, and apply it to the boil, and he will live.”

22.verse: Hezekiah had said, “What is the sign that I will go up to the House of ADONAI?”

1.verse: Hezekiah Shows Off - At that time Merodach-baladan, son of King Baladan of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah, for he had heard that he had been sick and had recovered.

2.verse: Now Hezekiah was pleased with them, so he showed them his treasure house—the silver and the gold, the spices and the precious oil—and his whole armory, and everything that was found in his treasuries. There was nothing in his house or in all his dominion that Hezekiah did not show them.

3.verse: Then Isaiah the prophet came to King Hezekiah and asked him, “What did these men say, and from where did they come to you?” Hezekiah replied, “They have come to me from a far country, from Babylon.”

4.verse: Then he asked, “What have they seen in your house?” Hezekiah said, “They have seen everything in my house. There is nothing among my treasuries that I didn’t show them.”

5.verse: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah: “Hear the word of ADONAI-Tzva’ot,

6.verse: ‘Behold, days are coming when everything in your house, which your fathers have stored up to this day, will be carried to Babylon—nothing will be left,’ says ADONAI.

7.verse: ‘Moreover, some of your descendants—who will issue from you, whom you will father—will be taken away and will become eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.’”

8.verse: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The word of ADONAI which you have spoken is good.” For he thought, “For there will be shalom and security in my days.”

1.verse: Comfort, Proclaim Good News - “Comfort, comfort My people,” says your God.

2.verse: Speak kindly to the heart of Jerusalem and proclaim to her that her warfare has ended, that her iniquity has been removed. For she has received from ADONAI’s hand double for all her sins.

3.verse: A voice cries out in the wilderness, “Prepare the way of ADONAI, Make straight in the desert a highway for our God.

4.verse: Every valley will be lifted up, every mountain and hill made low, the rough ground will be a plain and the rugged terrain smooth.

5.verse: The glory of ADONAI will be revealed, and all flesh will see it together.” For the mouth of ADONAI has spoken.

6.verse: A voice is saying, “Cry out!” So I said, “What shall I cry out?” “All flesh is grass, and all its loveliness is like the flower of the field.

7.verse: The grass withers, the flower fades. For the breath of ADONAI blows on it. Surely the people are grass.

8.verse: The grass withers, the flower fades. But the word of our God stands forever.”

9.verse: Get yourself up on a high mountain, you who bring good news to Zion! Lift up your voice with strength, you who bring good news to Jerusalem! Lift it up! Do not fear! Say to the cities of Judah: “Behold your God!”

10.verse: Look, ADONAI Elohim comes with might, with His arm ruling for Him. Behold, His reward is with Him, and His recompense before Him.

11.verse: Like a shepherd, He tends His flock. He gathers the lambs in His arms carries them in his bosom, and gently guides nursing ewes.

12.verse: Who Is Like Him? - Who has measured the waters in the palm of His hand, or measured out heaven with a span, or calculated the dust of the earth in a measure, or weighed the mountains in scales, or the hills in a balance?

13.verse: Who can fathom the Ruach ADONAI? Or instruct Him as His counselor?

14.verse: With whom did He consult, and who instructed Him? Who taught Him in the path of justice or taught Him knowledge? Who informed Him about the way of understanding?

15.verse: Behold, the nations are like a drop from a bucket, and count as a speck of dust on the scales. Behold, the islands weigh as fine dust.

16.verse: Lebanon is not enough to burn, or its animals enough for a burnt offering.

17.verse: All the nations are as nothing before Him. By Him they are accounted null and void.

18.verse: To whom then will you liken God? To what likeness will you compare Him?

19.verse: To an idol? A craftsman casts it, a goldsmith overlays it with gold and fashions silver chains for it.

20.verse: One too poor for such an offering chooses wood that will not rot. He looks for a skilled craftsman to prepare him an idol that will not totter.

21.verse: Do you not know? Have you not heard? Has it not been told to you from the beginning? Have you not understood from the foundations of the earth?

22.verse: He sits above the circle of the earth— its inhabitants are like grasshoppers— He stretches out the skies like a curtain, spreads them out like a tent to dwell in.

23.verse: He reduces princes to nothing. He makes the judges of the earth a confusion.

24.verse: Scarcely are they planted, scarcely are they sown, scarcely their stem takes root in the earth, when He blows on them and they wither, and a storm carries them off as stubble.

25.verse: “To whom then will you liken Me? Or who is My equal?” says the Holy One.

26.verse: Lift up your eyes on high, and see! Who created these? The One who brings out their host by number, the One who calls them all by name. Because of His great strength and vast power, not one is missing.

27.verse: Why do you say, O Jacob, and assert, O Israel, “My way is hidden from ADONAI, and the justice due me escapes the notice of my God”?

28.verse: Have you not known? Have you not heard? ADONAI is the eternal God, the Creator of the ends of the earth. He does not grow tired or weary. His understanding is unsearchable.

29.verse: He gives strength to the weary, and to one without vigor He adds might.

30.verse: Even youths grow tired and weary, and young men stumble and fall,

31.verse: but they who wait for ADONAI will renew their strength. They will soar up with wings as eagles. They will run, and not grow weary. They will walk, and not be faint.

1.verse: Coming Conqueror - “Be silent before Me, O islands! Let peoples renew their strength. Let them draw near, then let them speak. Let us come together for judgment.

2.verse: Who has stirred up one from the east? He calls justice to His feet. He gives nations over to him and subdues kings. He makes them like dust with his sword, as driven stubble with his bow.

3.verse: He pursues them, passing on safely, by a path his feet had not traveled.

4.verse: Who has performed and done it? Calling forth the generations from the beginning, I, ADONAI, am the first and the last, I am He!”

5.verse: The coastlands have seen and fear. The ends of the earth tremble. They draw near and come.

6.verse: Each one helps his neighbor and says to his brother, “Be strong!”

7.verse: The craftsman encourages the smith, who smooths with the hammer, who strikes with the anvil, saying of the soldering, “It’s good!” as he fastens it with nails so that it will not totter.

8.verse: My Servant, My Friend - “But you, Israel, My servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, descendant of Abraham, My friend—

9.verse: I took hold of you from the ends of the earth, and called from its uttermost parts, and said to you, ‘You are My servant— I have chosen you, not rejected you.

10.verse: Fear not, for I am with you, be not dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you. Surely I will help you. I will uphold you with My righteous right hand.

11.verse: Behold, all who were angry at you will be ashamed and disgraced. Those who quarrel with you will be as nothing and perish.

12.verse: Though you will look for those who contended with you, you will not find them. Those who warred against you will be as nothing at all.

13.verse: For I am ADONAI your God who upholds your right hand, who says to you, “Fear not, I will help you.”

14.verse: Fear not, you worm Jacob, you men of Israel! I will help you.” It is a declaration of ADONAI, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.

15.verse: “Look, I will make you a threshing sledge, new, with sharp, double-edged spikes. You will thresh the mountains and grind them up, and will make the hills like chaff.

16.verse: You will winnow them, and a wind will carry them away, a storm-wind will scatter them. But you will rejoice in ADONAI. You will glory in the Holy One of Israel.

17.verse: “The poor and needy ask for water, but there is none, Their tongues are parched with thirst. I, ADONAI, will answer them, I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.

18.verse: I will open rivers on the bare hills and springs in the midst of the valleys. I will make the wilderness a pool of water and the dry land into fountains of water.

19.verse: I will plant in the wilderness the cedar and the acacia tree, the myrtle and the olive tree. I will set in the desert the cypress tree and the pine together with the box tree—

20.verse: so they may see and know, consider and understand together, that the hand of ADONAI has done this, the Holy One of Israel has created it.”

21.verse: Challenge to Idolaters - “Present your case,” says ADONAI. “Bring forth your reasons,” says the King of Jacob.

22.verse: Let them bring forth and tell us what will happen. The former things, what were they? Tell us, that we may consider them and know their outcome. Or announce to us things to come.

23.verse: Declare the things coming afterward, so we may know that you are gods! Indeed, do good or do evil, so we may all see and be awestruck.

24.verse: Behold, you are nothing, and your work is null. Whoever chooses you is loathsome.

25.verse: “I have stirred up one from the north, and he has come. From the rising of the sun, He will call upon My Name. He will trample rulers as on mortar, like a potter treading clay.”

26.verse: Who told this from the beginning, so that we may know? Or from former times, so we may say, “He is right”? In fact, no one foretold it, In fact, no one announced it. In fact, no one heard Your words.

27.verse: First it was to Zion: “Behold, here they are!” And to Jerusalem: “I will give a herald of good news.”

28.verse: But when I look, there is no one. There is no counselor among them. When I ask them, they have no response.

29.verse: Indeed, they are all a delusion. Their works are null. Their molten images are wind and waste.

1.verse: First Servant Song: Justice - Behold My servant, whom I uphold. My Chosen One, in whom My soul delights. I have put My Ruach on Him, He will bring justice to the nations.

2.verse: He will not cry out or raise His voice, or make His voice heard in the street.

3.verse: A bruised reed He will not break. A smoldering wick He will not snuff out. He will faithfully bring forth justice.

4.verse: He will not be disheartened or crushed until He establishes justice on earth. The islands will wait for His Torah.

5.verse: Thus says God, ADONAI, who created the heavens and stretched them out, who spread out the earth and what comes from it, who gives breath to the people on it, and Ruach to those who walk in it—

6.verse: “I, ADONAI, called You in righteousness, I will take hold of Your hand, I will keep You and give You as a covenant to the people, as a light to the nations,

7.verse: by opening blind eyes, bringing prisoners out of the dungeon, and those sitting in darkness out of the prison house.

8.verse: “I am ADONAI—that is My Name! My glory I will not give to another, Or My praise to graven images.

9.verse: Behold, the former things have come to pass, Now I declare new things. Before they spring forth I announce them to you.”

10.verse: Sing to ADONAI a new song, His praise from the end of the earth, you who go down to the sea with all its fullness, islands and their inhabitants.

11.verse: Let the desert and its cities exult— the villages that Kedar inhabits. Let the dwellers of Sela sing for joy. Let them shout for joy from the top of the mountains.

12.verse: Let them give glory to ADONAI and declare His praise in the islands.

13.verse: ADONAI goes out as a mighty one. He stirs up His zeal like a man of war. He will shout, yes, raise a war cry! He will prevail over His enemies.

14.verse: “I have held My peace a long time, I have been still and restrained Myself. Now like a woman in labor I groan, gasping and panting at once.

15.verse: I will lay waste mountains and hills, and dry up all their vegetation. I will turn the rivers into islands, and dry up the pools.

16.verse: I will bring the blind by a way they do not know. in paths they have not known, I will guide them. I will turn darkness before them to light and the rough places smooth. These are the things I will do, and I will not forsake them.

17.verse: They will be turned back, utterly put to shame— those trusting in idols, who say to molten images, ‘You are our gods.’

18.verse: Hear, you deaf! Look, you blind, so you may see.

19.verse: Who is blind, but My Servant? Or deaf as My Messenger that I send? Who is so blind as the one in covenant with Me, blind as ADONAI’s Servant?

20.verse: You have seen many things, but you do not pay attention. Though ears are open, no one hears.”

21.verse: ADONAI was pleased, for the sake of His righteousness, to make Torah great and glorious.

22.verse: But this is a people robbed and looted. all of them trapped in holes, hidden away in prisons. They have become a prey with no one to deliver them, and plunder, with none to say, “Give them back!”

23.verse: Who among you will give ear to this? Who will listen and heed hereafter?

24.verse: Who gave Jacob to the looter, Israel to the plunderers? Was it not ADONAI? Have we not sinned against Him? In His ways they were unwilling to walk and His Torah they did not obey.

25.verse: So He poured out on him the fury of His anger, and the fierceness of battle. it blazed all around him, yet he did not understand it. it burned him, yet he did not take it to heart.

1.verse: Love for Israel - But now, thus says ADONAI— the One who created you, O Jacob, the One who formed you, O Israel: “Fear not, for I have redeemed you, I have called you by name, you are Mine.

2.verse: When you pass through the waters, I will be with you, or through the rivers, they will not overflow you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned, nor will the flame burn you.

3.verse: For I am ADONAI your God, the Holy One of Israel, your Savior. I have given Egypt as your ransom, Ethiopia and Seba in your place.

4.verse: Since you are precious in My eyes, honored, because I love you, I will give a man in exchange for you, and other peoples for your life.

5.verse: Do not fear, for I am with you. I will bring your offspring from the east and gather you from the west.

6.verse: I will say to the north, ‘Give them up!’ and to the south, ‘Do not hold them back.’ Bring My sons from far and My daughters from the ends of the earth.

7.verse: Everyone who is called by My Name, whom I created for My glory. I formed him—yes, I made him!”

8.verse: You Are My Witnesses - Bring out the people who are blind, yet have eyes, who are deaf, yet have ears.

9.verse: All the nations are gathered together, and the peoples are assembled. Who among them can declare this, and proclaim to us former things? Let them present their witnesses so they may be justified, or let them hear and say, “It’s true.”

10.verse: “You are My witnesses” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “and My Servant whom I have chosen, so that you may know and believe Me, and understand that I am He. Before Me no God was formed, and there will none after Me.

11.verse: “I, I am ADONAI— and there is no savior beside Me.

12.verse: I alone declared, saved and proclaimed, and not some foreign god among you. So you are My witnesses” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “and I am God.

13.verse: From eternity, I am He. None can deliver from My hand. I act, and who can reverse it?”

14.verse: Thus says ADONAI, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: “For your sake I will send to Babylon and bring down the fleeing Chaldeans, all of them, in the ships in which they exult.

15.verse: I am ADONAI, your Holy One, the Creator of Israel, your King.”

16.verse: Thus says ADONAI, who makes a way in the sea and a path in the mighty waters.

17.verse: who drew out chariots and horses, the army and the warrior (they will lie down together, and not rise again; they are extinguished—quenched like a wick):

18.verse: “Do not remember former things, nor consider things of the past.

19.verse: Here I am, doing a new thing; Now it is springing up— do you not know about it? I will surely make a way in the desert, rivers in the wasteland.

20.verse: The field animals honor Me —the jackals and the ostriches— because I give waters in the desert, rivers in the wilderness, to give drink to My chosen people,

21.verse: the people I formed for Myself, so they might declare My praise.

22.verse: Yet you have not called on Me, Jacob, for you have been weary of Me, Israel.

23.verse: You have not brought Me sheep for your burnt offerings; nor have you honored Me with your sacrifices. I did not compel you to serve offerings nor wearied you with incense.

24.verse: You have not spent money buying Me aromatic cane, nor have you satisfied Me with the fat of your sacrifices. Rather you burdened Me with your sins, wearied Me with your iniquities.

25.verse: I, I am the One who blots out your transgressions for My own sake, and will not remember your sins.

26.verse: Remind me, when we argue our case together— state your case, so you may be proved right.

27.verse: Your first father sinned, and your mediators rebelled against Me.

28.verse: So I profaned the Sanctuary officials, and gave Jacob over to destruction, and Israel to scorn.

1.verse: No Profit in Casting Idols - “But now listen, Jacob My servant, Israel, whom I have chosen.”

2.verse: Thus says ADONAI who made you, and formed you from the womb, who will help you: “Do not fear, Jacob My servant, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.

3.verse: For I will pour water on the thirsty land and streams on the dry ground. I will pour My Spirit on your offspring, and My blessing on your descendants.

4.verse: They will spring up among the grass like willows by flowing streams.

5.verse: This one will say, ‘I am ADONAI’s.’ That one will be called by the name Jacob. Another will write on his hand, ‘ADONAI’s’ and will take the name Israel.”

6.verse: First and Last - Thus says ADONAI, Israel’s King and his Redeemer, ADONAI-Tzva’ot: “I am the first, and the last, and there is no God beside Me.

7.verse: Who is like Me? Let him proclaim and announce it! Let him arrange it in order for Me— as I established the ancient nation. Let them declare to them what is coming and future events.

8.verse: Do not dread or be afraid. Have I not told you and declared it long ago? So you are My witnesses! Is there any God beside Me? Is there any other Rock? I know of none.

9.verse: Folly of Idols - Those who fashion idols are empty. Their precious things do not profit. Their witnesses do not see or know, so they will be put to shame.

10.verse: Who fashions a god or casts an idol for no profit?

11.verse: Behold, all his friends will be ashamed, for the craftsmen are only human. Let them all assemble. Let them stand up. Let them dread. Let them be put to shame together.

12.verse: The blacksmith takes a tool and works with it over the coals, fashioning it with hammers and working it with his strong arm. Yet when he is hungry, his strength fails. When he drinks no water, he gets tired.

13.verse: A carpenter stretches out a line; he marks it with a pencil; he shapes it with planes; he marks it with a compass; he shapes it like the figure of a man —like the beauty of a man— so that it may sit in a shrine.

14.verse: He chops down cedars for himself, or he takes a cypress or an oak. He lets it grow strong among the trees of the forest. He plants a pine and rain nourishes it.

15.verse: Then it is something for a man to burn. so he takes one of them and warms himself. He also makes a fire to bake bread. He also makes a god and worships it. He makes an idol and bows before it.

16.verse: He burns half of it in the fire. With this half, he eats meat. He roasts a roast and is satisfied. He also warms himself and says, “Ah! I am warm, I have seen the fire.”

17.verse: Yet with the rest he makes a god, his carved image. He falls down before it and worships. He even prays to it and says, “Deliver me, for you are my god!”

18.verse: They do not know or understand! For He smeared over their eyes, so they cannot see, and their hearts, so they cannot understand.

19.verse: No one reflects in his heart, with no knowledge or discernment to say, “I burned half of it in the fire and I also baked bread on its coals. I roasted meat and ate— and then I make the rest of it an abomination? Should I bow before a block of wood?”

20.verse: He is feeding on ashes. A deceived heart has led him astray, so he cannot deliver his soul, nor say, “Isn’t what is in my right hand a fraud?”

21.verse: Remember these things, Jacob, and Israel, for you are My servant. I formed you, you are My servant. Israel, you will not be forgotten by Me!

22.verse: I have blotted out your transgressions like a thick cloud and your sins like a mist. Return to Me, for I have redeemed you.”

23.verse: Sing, O heavens, for ADONAI has done it! Shout, depths of the earth! Break forth into singing, mountains, forest, and every tree in it! For ADONAI has redeemed Jacob and will be glorified through Israel.

24.verse: Thus says ADONAI, your Redeemer, who formed you from the womb: “I am ADONAI, Maker of all things, stretching out the heavens alone, spreading the earth abroad by Myself,

25.verse: causing the omens of boasters to fail, making fools of diviners, turning wise men backward and making their knowledge foolish,

26.verse: while confirming the word of His servant, fulfilling the counsel of His messengers, saying of Jerusalem, “She will be lived in” and of the cities of Judah, “They will be built, and I will raise up their ruins,”

27.verse: while saying to the deep, “Be dry, I will dry up your rivers,”

28.verse: while saying of Cyrus, “He is My shepherd, and he shall fulfill all My purpose” while saying to Jerusalem, “You will be built” and to the Temple, “Your foundation will be laid.”

1.verse: Cyrus the Anointed - Thus says ADONAI to His anointed, Cyrus, whose right hand I have grasped, to subdue nations before him, to loose the belts of kings, to open doors before him so that gates may not be shut.

2.verse: I will go before you and make crooked places straight. I will shatter bronze doors and cut through iron bars.

3.verse: I will give you treasures of darkness and hidden riches of secret places, so you may know that I am ADONAI, the God of Israel, who calls you by your name.

4.verse: For the sake of Jacob My servant, and Israel My chosen one, I have also called you by name, I have given you a title of honor, though you have not known Me.

5.verse: I am ADONAI—there is no other. Besides Me there is no God. I will strengthen you, though you have not known Me,

6.verse: so they may know, from the rising to the setting of the sun, that there is no one besides Me. I am ADONAI—there is no other.

7.verse: I form light and create darkness. I make shalom and create calamity. I, ADONAI, do all these things.

8.verse: “Rain down, O heavens, from above, and let the clouds pour down justice. Let the earth open up, let salvation sprout, and righteousness spring up with it. I, ADONAI, have created it.”

9.verse: Oy, to one who quarrels with his Maker, like a pot among the pots of the earth! Shall the clay say to the potter, “What have you made?” Or does your work say, “It has no handles”?

10.verse: Oy, to him who says to his father, “What have you begotten?” Or to a woman, “What have you born?”

11.verse: Thus says ADONAI, the Holy One of Israel and its Maker, “Ask Me about the things to come upon My children. Then you will commit to Me the work of My hands.

12.verse: I made the earth and created man on it. My hands stretched out the heavens and I commanded all their host.

13.verse: “I stirred Cyrus up in righteousness and I will level all his roads. He will build My city and set My exiles free, with no price or bribe,” says ADONAI-Tzva’ot.

14.verse: Thus says ADONAI: “Egypt’s toil, Ethiopia’s merchandise, and the tall Sabeans will come over to you and be yours. They will walk behind you in chains. They will bow down to you, and pray, saying, ‘Surely God is with you!’ There is none else—no other God!”

15.verse: Mystery of Creation - Truly You are a God who hides Himself, O God of Israel, Savior!

16.verse: All of them will be ashamed, disgraced— idol-makers go in dishonor together.

17.verse: Israel has been saved by ADONAI with an everlasting salvation. You will not be put to shame or disgraced, for ever and ever.

18.verse: For thus says ADONAI— He is God who fashioned the heavens, who formed the earth and made it, He established it and did not create it desolate but formed it to be inhabited— “I am ADONAI—there is no other!”

19.verse: “I have not spoken in secret, in a place of a land of darkness. I did not say to the seed of Jacob, ‘Seek Me in desolation.’ I, ADONAI, speak righteousness, declaring uprightly.”

20.verse: No Other God and Savior - “Assemble yourselves and come, draw near together, fugitives of the nations! Those who carry their wooden idols have no knowledge, praying to a god who cannot save.

21.verse: Declare and present your case, Indeed, let them consult together. Who foretold this from ancient time? Who has declared it of old? Is it not I, ADONAI? There is no other God beside Me —a righteous God and a Savior— there is none besides Me!

22.verse: Turn to Me, and be saved, all the ends of the earth. For I am God—there is no other.

23.verse: By Myself I have sworn— the word has gone forth from My mouth in righteousness, and is irrevocable: that to Me every knee will bow, every tongue will swear.

24.verse: They will say of Me, ‘Only in ADONAI is righteousness and strength.’ All who have raged against Him will come to Him and be put to shame.

25.verse: In ADONAI all the seed of Israel will be justified and give praise.”

1.verse: Idols a Weary Burden - Bel bows down; Nebo stoops over. Their idols are for beasts and cattle. The things you carry are borne as burdens on weary beasts.

2.verse: They stoop, they bow down together, they cannot save the burden, but themselves go into captivity.

3.verse: “Listen to Me, house of Jacob, all the remnant of the house of Israel, borne by Me from birth, carried from the womb.

4.verse: Even to your old age I will be the same, until you are gray I will carry you. I have done it; I will bear you; I will carry you; I will deliver you.

5.verse: To whom will you liken Me, or make Me equal or compare Me, that we should be alike?

6.verse: They lavish gold from a purse and weigh out silver on the scales. They hire a goldsmith so he makes a god. They bow down. Yes, they worship it.

7.verse: They lift it upon a shoulder and carry it. They set in its place and there it stands. It does not budge from its place. Even if one cry to it, it cannot answer, nor save anyone from his trouble.”

8.verse: Purpose for Cyrus - “Remember this, and be assured. Recall it to mind, you transgressors.

9.verse: Remember the former things of old: For I am God—there is no other. I am God, and there is none like Me—

10.verse: declaring the end from the beginning, from ancient time, what is yet to come, saying, “My purpose will stand, and I will accomplish all that I please.”

11.verse: From the east I am calling a bird of prey, a man for My purpose from a far country. Truly I have spoken; I will bring it to pass; I have planned it; surely I will do it.

12.verse: Listen to Me, you stubborn-hearted, who are far from righteousness:

13.verse: I bring My justice near, it is not far off. So My salvation will not delay. I put salvation in Zion, My glory in Israel.”

1.verse: Catastrophe of Babylon - Come down and sit in the dust, virgin daughter of Babylon. Sit on the ground without a throne, daughter of the Chaldeans. For you will no more be called tender and delicate.

2.verse: Take the millstones and grind flour. Remove your veil, strip off the skirt, uncover the leg, cross the rivers.

3.verse: Your nakedness will be uncovered, and your shame will be exposed. I will take vengeance, and will spare no one.

4.verse: Our Redeemer, ADONAI-Tzva’ot is His Name, is the Holy One of Israel.

5.verse: Sit in silence, go into darkness, daughter of the Chaldeans. For you will no more be called the mistress-queen of kingdoms.

6.verse: I was angry with My people. I profaned My heritage. I gave them into your hand, but you showed them no mercy. You made your yoke very heavy on the aged.

7.verse: You said, “Forever, I will be the eternal mistress-queen!” You did not lay these things to heart or remember their end.

8.verse: Now then, hear this, voluptuous one, dwelling securely, saying in your heart, “I am, and there is no one besides me! I will not sit as a widow, or know the loss of children,”

9.verse: These two things will come upon you in a moment, in one day— loss of children and widowhood— they will come upon you in full measure in spite of your many sorceries and your many spells.

10.verse: You felt secure in your wickedness, You said, “No one sees me.” Your wisdom and your knowledge led you astray, so you have said in your heart, “I am—there is no one else beside me!”

11.verse: But calamity will come upon you. You won’t know how to charm it away. Disaster will fall on you, for which you cannot atone. Catastrophe you cannot foresee will suddenly come upon you.

12.verse: Stand fast in your enchantments and your many sorceries, which you have toiled over since your youth. Perhaps you will succeed? Perhaps you will cause terror?

13.verse: You are weary of your consultations. So many! So let the astrologers, star-gazers, predicting by new moons, stand up and save you from what will come upon you.

14.verse: Behold, they shall be as stubble. Fire will consume them. They cannot deliver themselves from the power of the flame! It is not a coal for warming by or a fire to sit before!

15.verse: So much have they become to you, with whom you have toiled, trafficking with you from your youth, each wandering about his own way. No one will save you!

1.verse: Who Foretold These Things? - Hear this, house of Jacob, who are called by the Name of Israel, who came from the wellspring of Judah, who swear by the Name of ADONAI and confess the God of Israel— but not in truth or righteousness.

2.verse: For they call themselves by the holy city, and lean on the God of Israel, ADONAI-Tzva’ot is His Name.

3.verse: “I foretold the former things long ago. They went forth from My mouth, and I caused them to be heard. Suddenly I acted, so they came about.

4.verse: For I know that you are obstinate, and your neck is iron sinew, and your forehead bronze.

5.verse: So I foretold it to you long ago. before it came about I made you hear, lest you should say, ‘My idol did them, my carved image, yes, my molded image commanded them.’

6.verse: You have heard. See all of it. So will you not admit it? I proclaim to you new things from now on— hidden things that you have not known.

7.verse: They are created now, not long ago. Before today you had not heard them. So you will not say, ‘Sure, I knew them.’

8.verse: You have not heard; you never knew; even from long ago your ear has not been open. For I knew that you are treacherous, and from birth were called a rebel.

9.verse: For My Name’s sake I defer My anger, for My praise I will restrain it for you— otherwise I would cut you off.

10.verse: Behold, I have refined you, though not as silver. I tested you in the furnace of affliction.

11.verse: For My own sake, for My own sake, I act. For how should I be profaned? I will not give My glory to another.

12.verse: Listen to Me, Jacob, Israel whom I called: I am He; I am the first; I am also the last.

13.verse: Surely My hand founded the earth, My right hand spread out the heavens. When I call to them, they stand together.

14.verse: Assemble, all of you, and listen! Who among them foretold these things? ADONAI loves him. He will do His will against Babylon— His arm against the Chaldeans.

15.verse: I, I have spoken, yes I called him. I will bring him, so his ways will succeed.

16.verse: Draw near to Me, hear this: Since the beginning, I have not spoken in secret. From the time it existed, I was there. So now ADONAI Elohim has sent Me, and His Ruach.”

17.verse: Thus says ADONAI, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: “I am ADONAI your God, who teaches you to profit, who leads you in the way you should go.

18.verse: If only you had listened to My commandments! then your peace would be like a river, and your righteousness like the waves of the sea.

19.verse: Your seed would have been like sand, and your offspring like its grains. Their name would never be cut off or destroyed from before Me.”

20.verse: “Get out of Babylon, flee from Chaldea! With a shout of joy, proclaim this, send it out to the end of the earth, say: ‘ADONAI has redeemed His servant Jacob!

21.verse: They did not thirst when He led them through the deserts. He caused the water to flow out of the rock for them. He split the rock also, and the waters gushed out.’”

22.verse: “There is no shalom,” says ADONAI, “for the wicked.”

1.verse: Second Servant Song: Light of the Nations - Listen, to Me, islands! Pay attention, peoples far away. ADONAI called Me from the womb, from My mother’s belly He named Me.

2.verse: He made My mouth like a sharp sword. In the shadow of His hand He hid Me. He made Me a polished arrow, He has hidden Me in His quiver.

3.verse: He said to Me, “You are My servant, Israel, in whom I will be glorified.”

4.verse: But I said, “I have labored in vain, I have spent my strength for nothing and futility. Yet surely the justice due to me is with ADONAI, and my reward with my God.”

5.verse: So now says ADONAI, who formed Me from the womb to be His servant, to bring Jacob back to Him, to gather Israel back to Him. For I am honored in the eyes of ADONAI and My God has become my strength.

6.verse: So He says, “It is too trifling a thing that You should be My servant to raise up the tribes of Jacob and restore the preserved ones of Israel. So I will give You as a light for the nations, that You should be My salvation to the end of the earth.”

7.verse: Thus says ADONAI, the Redeemer of Israel, their Holy One, to the One despised, to the One the nation abhors, to a servant of rulers: “Kings will see and arise, princes will also bow down, because of ADONAI who is faithful, the Holy One of Israel who has chosen You.”

8.verse: Compassion on Zion’s Children - Thus says ADONAI: “In a time of favor I will answer you. In a day of salvation I will help you. I will keep You and give You as a covenant to the people, to restore the land, to make them possess its desolate inheritances,

9.verse: saying to the prisoners, ‘Come out!’ to those in darkness, ‘Be shown!’ Along the roads they will graze— their pasture will be on all the barren heights.

10.verse: They will not hunger or thirst, nor scorching wind or sun strike them, for their compassionate One will lead them, and will guide them by springs of water.

11.verse: I will make all My mountains a road, and My highways will be raised up.

12.verse: “Behold, these shall come from afar. behold, these from the north and from the west, and from the land of Sinim.

13.verse: Shout for joy, heavens! Rejoice, earth! Break forth into ringing shouts, O mountains! For ADONAI has comforted His people and has compassion on His afflicted.”

14.verse: But Zion said: “ADONAI has forsaken me, ADONAI has forgotten me.”

15.verse: “Can a woman forget her nursing baby or lack compassion for a child of her womb? Even if these forget, I will not forget you.

16.verse: Behold, I have engraved you on the palms of My hands. Your walls are continually before Me.

17.verse: Your children will come quickly. Your destroyers and devastators will go away from you.

18.verse: Lift up your eyes around and see: all of them will gather and come to you.” “As I live” —it is ADONAI’s declaration— “you will wear them all as jewelry and bind them on like a bride.”

19.verse: For your waste and desolate places and your destroyed land will now be surely too small for the inhabitants, and those who swallowed you up will be far away.

20.verse: The children of your bereavement will yet say in your ears, “The place is too cramped for me! Make room for me to settle in.”

21.verse: Then you will say in your heart, “Who has borne these for me? Wasn’t I bereaved of my children— barren, an exile and wandering? So who has raised these? Behold, I was left alone— these, where were they?”

22.verse: Thus says ADONAI Elohim: “Look, I will lift My hand to the nations, and raise My banner to the peoples! They will bring your sons on their chest, and carry your daughters on their shoulders.

23.verse: Kings will be your guardians, their princesses your nurses. They will bow down to you with their face to the ground, and lick the dust of your feet. Then you will know that I am ADONAI— those hoping in Me will not be ashamed.”

24.verse: Can plunder be taken from the mighty, or captives of the righteous freed?

25.verse: For thus says ADONAI: “Yes, captives of the mighty will be taken and the prey of the tyrant will be freed. For I will oppose your adversary. I will save your children.

26.verse: I will feed your oppressors their flesh. They will be drunk with their blood as with sweet wine. Then all flesh will know that I, ADONAI, am your Savior and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.”

1.verse: Thus says ADONAI: “Where is the divorce certificate, by which I sent your mother away? Or to whom of My creditors did I sell you? See, you were sold for your iniquities, and for your transgressions your mother was sent away.

2.verse: Why was no one there when I came? Why was there no one to answer when I called? Is My hand too short to redeem? Or have I no power to deliver? Behold, I dry up the sea at My rebuke, I make rivers a wilderness— their fish stink for lack of water and die of thirst.

3.verse: I clothe the heavens with blackness and make sackcloth their covering.”

4.verse: Third Servant Song: Face Like Flint - ADONAI Elohim has given Me the tongue of the learned, that I may know how to sustain the weary with a word. He awakens Me morning by morning. He awakens My ear to give heed as a disciple.

5.verse: ADONAI Elohim has opened My ear, and I was not rebellious, nor did I turn back.

6.verse: I gave My back to those who strike, and My cheeks to those pulling out My beard; I did not hide My face from humiliation and spitting.

7.verse: For ADONAI Elohim will help Me. Therefore I have not been disgraced. Therefore I set My face like flint, and I know that I will not be ashamed.

8.verse: The One who vindicates Me is near. Who will accuse Me? Let us stand up to each other. Who is My adversary? Let him confront Me.

9.verse: See, ADONAI Elohim will help Me. Who is he who would condemn Me? See, they all wear out like a garment. A moth will eat them up.

10.verse: Who among you fears ADONAI? Who hears the voice of His servant? Who walks in darkness and has no light? Let him trust in the Name of ADONAI and lean on his God.

11.verse: “Behold, all you who kindle a fire, encircling yourselves with firebrands. Walk in the light of your fire and among the brands you have lit. This you will have from My hand: you will lie down in torment.”

1.verse: Comfort Zion With Justice - “Listen to Me, you who pursue justice, you who seek ADONAI. Look to the rock from which you were hewn, and to the quarry from which you were dug.

2.verse: Look to Abraham your father and to Sarah who bore you. For when I called him, he was but one, then I blessed him and multiplied him.”

3.verse: For ADONAI will comfort Zion. He will comfort all her waste places. He will make her wilderness like Eden, her desert like the garden of ADONAI. Joy and gladness will be found in her, thanksgiving and a sound of melody.

4.verse: “Pay attention to Me, My people, give ear to Me, My nation. For Torah will go out from Me, My justice as a light to the peoples.

5.verse: My righteousness is near, My salvation has gone out, and My arms will judge the nations. The coastlands will wait for Me— for My arm they will wait expectantly.

6.verse: Lift up your eyes to the heavens, and look at the earth beneath. For the heavens will vanish like smoke, the earth will wear out like a garment, and its inhabitants will die like gnats, but My salvation will be forever, and My righteousness never wane.

7.verse: Listen to Me, you who know justice, a people with My Torah in their heart: Do not fear the taunt of men, nor be dismayed at their insults.

8.verse: For the moth will eat them like a garment, and the worm will eat them like wool. But My righteousness will be forever and My salvation for all generations.”

9.verse: Awake, awake, put on strength, O arm of ADONAI, awake, as in days of old, the generations of long ago. Was it not You who cut Rahab in pieces, who pierced the dragon?

10.verse: Was it not You who dried up the sea, the waters of the great deep, who made the depths of the sea a path for the redeemed to pass over?

11.verse: Now the ransomed of ADONAI will return, and come to Zion with singing. Everlasting joy will be upon their heads. They will obtain gladness and joy, and sorrow and sighing will flee away.

12.verse: “I, I am the One who comforts you. Who are you that you should fear man, who dies, or a son of man, who is given up like grass?”

13.verse: But you forgot ADONAI your Maker, who stretched out the heavens and laid the foundations of the earth. Are you in constant dread all day because of the fury of the oppressor as he makes ready to destroy? But where is the fury of the oppressor?

14.verse: Soon one bowed down will be released. He will not die and go to the Pit, nor will his bread be lacking.

15.verse: “For I am ADONAI your God, who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar— ADONAI-Tzva’ot is His Name.

16.verse: I have put My words in your mouth, and covered you with the shadow of My hand— I who set the heavens in place, who laid the foundations of the earth, and say to Zion, ‘You are My people.’”

17.verse: Awake, awake! Stand up, Jerusalem! From ADONAI’s hand you have drunk the cup of His fury, the chalice of reeling that you have drained to the dregs.

18.verse: There is none to guide her among all the sons she has borne, nor is there one to take her by the hand among all the sons she has raised.

19.verse: These two things have befallen you —who will mourn for you?— devastation and destruction, famine and the sword. How will I comfort you?

20.verse: Your sons have fainted. They lie at every street corner, like an antelope in a net. They are full of ADONAI’s fury, the rebuke of your God.

21.verse: Therefore hear this, you who are afflicted, who are drunk, but not with wine.

22.verse: Thus says your Lord, ADONAI your God who defends His people: “Behold, I have taken from your hand the cup of reeling, the bowl of My wrath. You will never drink it again.

23.verse: Then I will put it into the hand of your tormentors, who said to you, ‘Lie down, so we may walk over you.’ You have made your back like the ground and like a street for passersby.

1.verse: Ma Navu: The Song of Salvation - Awake, awake! Clothe yourself in your strength, Zion! Clothe yourself in beautiful garments, Jerusalem, the holy city, for the uncircumcised and the unclean will never invade you again.

2.verse: Shake off the dust and arise! Be enthroned, Jerusalem. Loose the bonds off your neck, captive Daughter of Zion.

3.verse: For thus says ADONAI: “You were sold for nothing. So you will be redeemed without silver.”

4.verse: For thus says ADONAI Elohim: “At first My people went down to Egypt to reside there, then the Assyrian oppressed them for nothing.

5.verse: “Now therefore, what do I have here?” —it is a declaration of ADONAI— “My people are taken away for nothing? Its rulers wail” —it is ADONAI’s declaration— “and My Name is continually blasphemed all day long.

6.verse: Therefore My people will know My Name. Therefore in that day, I am the One who will be saying, ‘Hineni!’”

7.verse: How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news, who announces shalom, who brings good news of happiness, who announces salvation, who says to Zion, “Your God reigns!”

8.verse: The voice of your watchmen—they will lift up their voices. Together they are shouting for joy! For they will see eye to eye when ADONAI returns to Zion.

9.verse: Break forth in joy, sing together, you ruins of Jerusalem, for ADONAI has comforted His people. He has redeemed Jerusalem.

10.verse: ADONAI has bared His holy arm before the eyes of all the nations. All the ends of the earth will see the salvation of our God.

11.verse: Leave, leave! Get out of there! Touch no unclean thing. Go out of her midst. Purify yourselves, you who carry the vessels of ADONAI.

12.verse: For you will not go out in haste, nor will you go in flight, for ADONAI will go before you, and the God of Israel will be your rear guard.

13.verse: Fourth Servant Song: The Lamb - “Behold, My servant will prosper, He will be high and lifted up and greatly exalted.

14.verse: Just as many were appalled at You— His appearance was disfigured more than any man, His form more than the sons of men.

15.verse: So He will sprinkle many nations. Kings will shut their mouths because of Him, for what had not been told them they will see, and what they had not heard they will perceive.

1.verse: Isaiah 53 - ‘Who has believed our report? To whom is the arm of ADONAI revealed?

2.verse: For He grew up before Him like a tender shoot, like a root out of dry ground. He had no form or majesty that we should look at Him, nor beauty that we should desire Him.

3.verse: He was despised and rejected by men, a man of sorrows, acquainted with grief, One from whom people hide their faces. He was despised, and we did not esteem Him.

4.verse: Surely He has borne our griefs and carried our pains. Yet we esteemed Him stricken, struck by God, and afflicted.

5.verse: But He was pierced because of our transgressions, crushed because of our iniquities. The chastisement for our shalom was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed.

6.verse: We all like sheep have gone astray. Each of us turned to his own way. So ADONAI has laid on Him the iniquity of us all.

7.verse: He was oppressed and He was afflicted yet He did not open His mouth. Like a lamb led to the slaughter, like a sheep before its shearers is silent, so He did not open His mouth.

8.verse: Because of oppression and judgment He was taken away. As for His generation, who considered? For He was cut off from the land of the living, for the transgression of my people— the stroke was theirs

9.verse: His grave was given with the wicked, and by a rich man in His death, though He had done no violence, nor was there any deceit in His mouth.

10.verse: Yet it pleased ADONAI to bruise Him. He caused Him to suffer. If He makes His soul a guilt offering, He will see His offspring, He will prolong His days, and the will of ADONAI will succeed by His hand.

11.verse: As a result of the anguish of His soul He will see it and be satisfied by His knowledge. The Righteous One, My Servant will make many righteous and He will bear their iniquities.

12.verse: Therefore I will give Him a portion with the great, and He will divide the spoil with the mighty— because He poured out His soul to death, and was counted with transgressors. For He bore the sin of many, and interceded for the transgressors.

1.verse: Your Husband is Your Maker - “Sing, barren one, who has not given birth. burst into singing and shout, you who have not travailed. For more are the children of the desolate than the children of the married one,” says ADONAI.

2.verse: “Enlarge the place of your tent, stretch out your tabernacle curtains. Do not hold back— lengthen your cords, strengthen your stakes.

3.verse: For you will spread out to the right hand and to the left. Your offspring will possess the nations and will resettle the desolate cities.

4.verse: Fear not, for you will not be ashamed. Nor cringe, for you will not be disgraced. For you will forget the shame of your youth, and you will remember the reproach of your widowhood no more.

5.verse: For your Maker is your husband —ADONAI-Tzva’ot is His Name— the Holy One of Israel is your Redeemer. He will be called God of all the earth.

6.verse: “For ADONAI has called you back like a wife deserted and grieved in spirit, like a wife of one’s youth that is rejected,” says your God.

7.verse: “For a brief moment I deserted you, but I will regather you with great compassion.

8.verse: In a surge of anger I hid My face from you a moment, but with everlasting kindness I will have compassion on you,” says ADONAI your Redeemer.

9.verse: “For this is like the waters of Noah to Me: for as I swore that the waters of Noah should no more cover the earth, so I have sworn that I will not be angry with you, nor will I rebuke you.

10.verse: Though the mountains depart and the hills be shaken, My love will not depart from you, nor will My covenant of peace be shaken, says ADONAI who has compassion on you.

11.verse: Afflicted one, storm-tossed, unconsoled, behold, I set your stones in antimony, lay your foundations with sapphires,

12.verse: make your pinnacles of rubies, your gates of crystal, and all your walls of precious stones.

13.verse: All your children will be taught by ADONAI. Your children will have great shalom.

14.verse: No Weapon Formed Against You - “In righteousness you will be established. You will be far from oppression —for you will not fear— and from terror— for it will not come near you.

15.verse: Behold, anyone fiercely attacking is not from Me. Whoever stirs up strife with you will fall because of you.

16.verse: Behold, I created the smith who blows the fire of coals and produces a weapon for its work, and I created the destroyer to ruin.

17.verse: No weapon formed against you will prosper and you will condemn every tongue that rises against you in judgment. This is the heritage of ADONAI’s servants— their vindication is from Me.” It is a declaration of ADONAI.

1.verse: Trees of the Field will Clap Their Hands - “Ho, everyone who thirsts, come to the water, and you who have no money, come, buy and eat. Come, buy wine and milk without money and without cost!

2.verse: Why do you spend money for what is not bread? Your wages for what does not satisfy? Listen diligently to Me, and eat what is good, and delight yourself in abundance.

3.verse: Incline your ear and come to Me. Listen, so that your soul may live. I will make an everlasting covenant with you, the trustworthy loyalty to David.
